reviews.title: Nice movie
reviews.content: What a thrilling cinematic experience! Sky Force does justice to the historical significance of India's first airstrike. The high-octane action sequences are complemented by a touching narrative. Sara Ali Khan shines in her role, showcasing vulnerability and strength. The movie's pacing keeps you on edge, and the visuals are breathtaking. Kudos to the team for portraying such a monumental event with precision and heart. This film is a brilliant reminder of the sacrifices our defense forces make. It's not just a movie-it's a salute to bravery! This film is a brilliant reminder of the sacrifices our defense forces make. It's not just a movie-it's a salute to bravery!

reviews.title: Sky force
reviews.content: Sky Force delivers a thrilling and emotional storyline that keeps you invested from start to finish. The movie brilliantly showcases the historic first airstrike by India, combining breathtaking aerial sequences with a deeply human narrative. The plot sheds light on the immense pressure faced by the pilots while highlighting their unwavering dedication. It also explores the emotional struggles of their loved ones, adding depth and relatability to the story. This film is a perfect mix of action, emotion, and inspiration. The movie brilliantly showcases the historic first airstrike by India, combining breathtaking aerial sequences with a deeply human narrative.

reviews.title: High-Flying Action with Grounded Storytelling!!
reviews.content: Skyforce delivers a visually stunning aerial action experience, with intense flight sequences that keep the adrenaline pumping. The cinematography excels in capturing high-stakes dogfights, making every jet maneuver feel immersive. The movie's themes of teamwork and sacrifice are commendable, adding emotional weight to the action.However, the storyline follows a predictable arc, leaning heavily on familiar military tropes without breaking new ground. The pacing lags in the middle, and some character dynamics feel underdeveloped, leaving certain emotional moments lacking impact.Overall, Skyforce is a solid action flick for fans of aviation dramas, but it doesn't quite soar to unforgettable heights.

reviews.title: Great patriotic story
reviews.content: This movie follows the real-life story of an Indian soldier who served in the Air Force during the 1965 war with Pakistan (not a spoiler; it is revealed in the trailer). The actors do their job extremely well in portraying those characters from the past. The makers took good care of the set design and the character look as all the characters were perfectly aligned with the looks prevalent in that day and age.However, I expected more aviation actions and maneuvers as the movie was sold as a sky-action movie. The makers kept all the action for the last part of the movie, which is good for a biopic but does not go well with avgeeks. The makers could have set a different expectations from this movie.In my opinion, I would recommend everyone to support this kind of movie as they are made upon the people who sacrificed their lives to protect their borders. The screenplay is good enough that it won't bore you even in a late-night movie.

reviews.title: Sky Force >>> Must watch movie
reviews.content: Sky Force delivers exceptional cinematography and action sequences, rivaling any top-tier Hollywood war film. The aerial dogfights, anti-aircraft fire, and ground strafing scenes are both exhilarating and impressively realistic. The attention to detail in these action scenes is commendable, providing a thrilling experience for viewers.However, there is a notable point of contention regarding the portrayal of the lead characters. Since the movie is based on the true story of Squadron Leader Ajjamada Boppayya Devayya of the Indian Air Force, it would have been more authentic to depict him and his wife as being of Coorgi descent, rather than as Tamil Brahmins. This detail would have stayed true to the real-life heritage of the individuals involved.The film serves as a tribute to the often overlooked war heroes, particularly those missing in action, and sheds light on stories that many Indians, especially younger generations, may not be familiar with. It honors the daring IAF attack on Pakistan's Sargodha Airfield, an operation that parallels the scale and significance of Japan's attack on Pearl Harbor during WWII. The movie also highlights the bureaucratic challenges faced by Squadron Commander Group Captain OP Taneja as he worked tirelessly to locate the missing hero, as well as the emotional turmoil experienced by the hero's wife, waiting for news of her husband.One aspect of the film that could have been improved was the way the past and present were intertwined toward the end. The montage felt a bit rushed, and a more deliberate approach could have allowed for a stronger emotional payoff, possibly eliciting a standing ovation from the audience.Akshay and Veer Paharia deliver stellar performances, capturing the emotional depth of their roles and bringing the story to life.A must watch movie for all.

reviews.title: Bad VFX but altogether a decent movie
reviews.content: This is my first time reviewing here and i think it's important considering bad PR is easy while the genuine people rarely provide their review. Veer pahariya and sara ali khan could have done better they couldn't act in the movie and only good thing about veer's acting was that his nose was similar to the actual actor nothing else.Akshay Kumar was too good it's evident why he has been relevant in the industry for so long. Loved every bit of his acting.The movie was crisp probably made so by the editing considering today's attention span and therefore there were moments in the film that weren't explored in the interest of time.

reviews.title: Must watch, 100% Goosebumps. Tribute to IAF!
reviews.content: Amazing movie, must watch in theaters. Not much fun watching in OOT's as this movie is all about special effects and amazing sound effects. Such movies comes once in a while! The sound effects and screenplay is amazing and must watch in theaters! Dont miss. No unwanted storyline, story is on the spot. Akshay Kumar has his best along will all other crew! Most importantly its something to know about India's brave hearts and history on how Sargodha airbase attack of Pakistan in the Indo-Pakistani air war of 1965. Tribute to Squadron Leader Ajjamada Boppayya Devayya & Group Captain O. P. Taneja. It shows high-stakes bravery, strategy, and sacrifice of Indian Air Force pilots, highlighting their pivotal role in shifting the course of the war.

reviews.title: Please stop doing Star Trek.
reviews.content: As a massive Star Trek fan, I am deeply disappointed by the continued involvement of Olatunde Osunsanmi in directing Star Trek projects. His work on Discovery fundamentally missed what makes Star Trek special, and now he is repeating those same disastrous choices with Section 31. Even with a talented cast, he has dragged the franchise down with juvenile, uninspired ideas that already failed in Discovery.This feels like a betrayal of what Star Trek stands for. Osunsanmi has managed to do the exact opposite of what Jon Favreau accomplished with Star Wars-instead of revitalising the franchise, he has dragged it into mediocrity. The result is not just a disappointment, but an embarrassment to the legacy of Star Trek.

reviews.title: Worst Star Trek movie ever
reviews.content: The only reason to call this a Star Trek movie is because they mention Starfleet several times. The cartoonish characters actually belong on Lower Decks, not in this mess. The story is rushed, the peril ridiculous and you get no time to process anything. Every alien species is brand new, with no chance for character development, other than their simplistic special abilities.Michelle Yeoh is always good as Philippe Georgiou, but not as the lead character. She needs a moral foil to her narcissistic anrrogance and that's completely missing without someone like Michael Burnham.This is obviously a pilot for a series that never happened... and that's a good thing. They need to stick with Starfleet stories.

reviews.title: Not Star Trek
reviews.content:
I liked Michelle Yeoh as Georgiu on Discovery but on this she's a different character completely
But this isn't Star Trek of any kind! It's also not Mission impossible in space as was suggested by one of the cast or Guardians of the Galaxy on steroids which was also suggested
It's a bog standard sci fi movie with elements of Star Trek dropped in
Also a pointless cameo at the end just to finish off the obsurdity
I watched the short film Unification recently multiple times and this was 100%+ better than this in its 8 mins entirety than this 100miles of tripe
Surely it's time for Kurtzman and this kind of trek to be eliminated.

reviews.title: Worst Oceans 11 Sequel EVER
reviews.content: Whoever at Paramount approved this needs to be forcibly ejected into the Mirror Universe. After a promising origin story opening of everyone's favourite psychopathic Emperor, the tone shifts to "amateur hour" with the worst voice over imaginable. There's no gravitas, there's no shame. It sounds like a cheap role playing game intro.As embarrassing that is for such an iconic franchise, it then gets worse. You can almost hear the hustle music as Danny Ocean enters the casino with his crew. Sorry, the Area 31 crack team overact as Michelle Yeoh does everything she can to save any potential in this appalling scenario. Even she can't save this mess.If you have fond memories of high quality scripts, acting and plot, do not forget the love of tribbles waste your precious time with this abomination. How dare they do this to a beloved character / actor / premise.

reviews.title: This Should Be Deleted From P+ AND Canon
reviews.content: Wow, as a lifelong Trekkie, I've sat through some bad Trek over the years... I don't know what this is but it isn't Trek. It is worse than the worst episode of the worst series you can think of. Yes, even worse than THAT one. I couldn't last 10 minutes before scrubbing through the rest. I'm going to spend the rest of my night doing something more engaging, like staring at my wall.After the cold intro, which is completely obvious what is happening, and completely devoid of emotions, we get an exposition dump of Section 31 and the mirror universe. As though they want to market this to people who have never seen Trek. Unsuccessfully, I'd add. Instead, have alienated people who do by treating us like morons.

reviews.title: Awful, but at least it's short
reviews.content: I can see this movie being passable if it'd just been a standalone movie not attached to the Star Trek brand. It still wouldn't have been good, but a lot of the problems with it wouldn't have stood out as much. It would have just been another generic straight-to-streaming slop movie.As it is, this sucked. It didn't do anything interesting with the setting, it didn't have a story that could only be told in a Star Trek setting, and it didn't even do all that much with Section 31 as an idea. I'm glad this was never a full season of TV, as was originally planned, because eight hours of this would have been a nightmare.The nicest thing I can say about this is that at least it's short. 95 minutes is a good length for what this was. At least nobody felt the need to drag it out to two hours, which happens too often with movies nowadays.

reviews.title: BARF
reviews.content: I'm pretty sure my title says it all. I'm speechless, it's horrible. It's terrible. It's lunacy that this even got made, yet alone as a part of the Star Trek universe. Pathetic. One may ask, "why" did they write let alone produce a movie that fails in EVERY way in first place?! Vanity, hubris or just plain and simple stupidity. For fans of Star Trek, this is an affront to what it's supposed to be. I cannot understand at what point, anyone that even has a passing interest in the Star Trek universe, would walk away from this film, and not be thinkkng, "what is gods name was that?" It's that bad. I say it's even worse, much worse.

reviews.title: I watched it to enjoy it...seems like others watched it just to hate it...
reviews.content: ...so, who really wasted their time more?I didn't need this to be an episode of Star Trek. Not everything in the Trek universe needs to be given to us as a serial episode and people who think otherwise are extremely limited. Was a bit disappointed we didn't see more of what happened immediately after Georgiou arrived from the future, and how she came to be at station she was running or even what year it was specifically, but I enjoyed the movie. The story was solid and expanded a bit on Mirror Georgiou's history, the action was good, and enjoyed Yeoh's performance, the young Garret and the Irish Vulcan. It's not winning any awards but was a good Friday night in watch.

reviews.title: Whatever it is, it is N9T Star Trek
reviews.content: Right from the getgo, this is definitely not Star Trek. Its as though someone decided to describe Star Trak in English tona person who only speaks Espiranto and not well at that.The characters are unlikable, confusing & annoying, the plot, disjjointed & rudderless, the dialogue formulatic, the acting wooden & the effects look n9re like low budget fan fic than a major production.Only real decent thing in it is they knock the characters off quite regularly.It's not even mildly enjoyable & quite painful to watch.If you love or even only like the franchise & enjoy good Sci Fi, do yourself a favour and give it a miss.

reviews.title: Absolute rubbish
reviews.content: Seriously, I had high hopes for this 'movie' but it was a complete waste of time. Unlikeable characters, bad acting, and in my eyes the complete opposite of what Section 31 was about. I love all things Trek, but this was embarrassing to watch üò´Once you get past the lens flares, the set designs and style are quite good, but it all comes back to the plot, and I know I said it before but the characters... they just ruined it for me. The seriously bad Irish accent?? Why??Definitely a rushed idea pushed through while we wait for the new series of Strange New Worlds. Avoid, avoid, avoid. Please!

reviews.title: Not Trek... Not Even Section 31
reviews.content: The good: Yeoh is brilliant as she always is and it was occasionally amusing.The bad: This is a campy Suicide Squad with the Section 31 name and JUST enough tiny elements to connect it to a Star Trek franchise.The ugly: This whole thing is a slap in the face to fans who have wanted something Section 31 since they debuted on DS9. Instead of a clandestine professional organization we got a bunch of lunatics who were frankly annoying. Also... feel free to check my math but if that was supposed to be THE Rachel Garret... how old was she when she commanded Enterprise C? 94? Bad chronology. Also, I wasn't really a fan of the unoriginal idea that the leader of the Terran Empire was chosen in the Hunger Games.I don't pretend to be a screen play writer but fans should have been solicited for story ideas. We'd have gotten what we waited for all these years. This was garbage.

reviews.title: Nobody asked for this movie and they were right no to
reviews.content:
Who was this made for? ST fans or newcommers? The way too long exposition dump in the form of a transmission at the beginning is unprofessional, cheap, and it tries to explain Discovery season 1 basically. New viewers won't even know what is what, and fans probably know about STD.I've seen better fan productions. It's too dark, it has bad timing, thin plot, amateurish jump cuts, the music trying to be so dramatic, it's actually comical. The camera work has random cheesy zooms. You can tell this was probably made to be a tv show. In the scene when the bad guy tries to push the blade of the sword into Michelle Yeoh's face it sounds like it was ADR-ed, but done very poorly.Star Trek is always trying to raise the stakes recently, every season of every show is trying to save the world/universe/entire galaxy, and this movie is no exception. It has no good character moments that would drive the show other than the other thing ST does these days: revenge as motivation for the enemy.Because it's a prequel we all know the world will be saved, but at least they could have killed Georgiou in a way that she could redeem herself. Also this would ensure no more of this horrible storyline.Roddenberry is rolling in his grave. I'm done with this JJ - Kurtzman era if this is a sign of what the Academy show is going to be like. I am a life long Star Trek fan, but I think this would be something I wouldn't like even if I wasn't.UPDATE
Oh, also this movie is so full of plot holes. Section 31 is supposed to be a covert operation and they just meet in bars, and even the wife of the impostor knows who they are at the end of the movie.The Discount Mr T. Character who is an augment, how did he get there? Was he with Khan in the Botany Bay? The timeline doesnt make much sense to me.Why is part of the movie about how they originally wanted to capture the Yeoh? How does that move the story forward?They have been trying to strip away everything that makes Star Trek... Star Trek, and I think they maxed this out with this movie. There is absolutely nothing ST in this. If this movie was any darker it would be like the final battle in GoT.

reviews.title: The worst ST movie ever
reviews.content: Other users have written detailed reviews, so I will make it short:This is by far the worst ST movie ever made. This even isn't ST in my opinion. They tried to make a ridiculous superhero movie out of this. It feels like a disgusting mix of space opera, Mission Impossible and wannabe-Marvel movies. And they failed so badly, I fear it could distort the time-space-continuum.This lousy piece of... is an insult for every loyal ST fan. I would be interested what the creators were thinking when they wrote the script. If they were thinking at all.The movie is incredibly boring, the special effects are mediocre, it features wooden acting and the story is plain stupid.Do yourself a favor and don't waste a single minute of your precious life time on this.

reviews.title: John Wick in space.
reviews.content: How this mess ever got the green light is totally beyond me. It looks like they used the sets of other Star Trek shows to save money on production costs. I'm sure I recognised part of the 'bridge' from Strange New Worlds. The completely 'over the top' fight scenes looked like something out of the John Wick franchise.How they had the audacity to play the signiture Star Trek theme towards the end and then say in the credits that it was "based on Star Trek by Gene Roddenberry" is completely taking the preverbial.While watching this "movie" I actually began to think that Paramount were deliberately trying to ruin the Star Trek franchise.

reviews.title: There are no words.
reviews.content: There are no words to describe how bad this movie is. Sorry, its just awful. It is not Star Trek in the truest sense, just unashamedly using the brand thanks to some loose connection to it and the piffle that was "Discovery." So badly written with awkward dialogue that neither provokes thought, imagination nor interest.Section 31 is a waste of Michelle Yeoh and her character, who I'd thought was back in the mirror universe. A mirror universe Trek may have been worth it if they'd somehow shown the contrast in a mirror universe/prime universe story. But not this.One out of ten purely because I can't rate it zero. I hope I never see its like again.

reviews.title: 3 stars for the occasional special effects.
reviews.content: This isn't just the worst Star Trek Movie; it is also the worst Star Trek based show in the Star Trek Universe.The story is weak, the acting is terrible, there aren't enough expletives to express how poor the overall satisfaction rating is.I'm genuinely trying to not include any spoilers in this review, there's also a part of me that wants to, just to spare you (dear reader) the pain of having to endure what I just did, which was this tragedy.Having said all that, if you have absolutely nothing to do; and I mean absolutely nothing, then why not put this on whilst you ebd up playing on your phone instead.

reviews.title: Fast Paced and Exciting Entertainment
reviews.content: Similar in pace and feel as the Aliens movie, this is in my opinion, second only to Wrath Of Khan in the entire Star Trek canon in terms of quality. Ah, but there's that troublesome word, "canon". This movie is very definitely NOT in any way representative of all the Star Trek movies and series. With the possible exception of the two part In A Mirror Darkly episode Of Star Trek Enterprise, that is. Or the first Star Trek Kelvin timeline movie. This is not a bad thing, actually. I am one of those who did not much care for the Star Trek The Next Generation series because they were always so very obsessed with the Prime Directive that most of the time I wanted to just slap Jean Luc Picard senseless until he decided to grow a pair. It would have been impossible for the crew to accomplish much of anything because they were always being so caring, considerate and full of empathy. So when they invariably finally came up with a solution for the 52 minute problem at hand, it usually came off as pat, contrived and forced.Section 31 does not have that problem. It is an action adventure sci-fi roller coaster ride, pure and simple. The characters are not particularly likeable. They're not supposed to be. They are a group of spies and assassins. In fact the only reason I did not give it 10 out of 10 was that they tried to redeem Phillippa Georgiou's story arc towards the end. Somewhat. Kinda like pulling a punch. You're still hitting them in the face, but you're not deliberately trying to kill them. Like that. It lessened the character's impact and threw into question decisions she'd made before and would later make. The opening scene of Section 31 had pretty much trodden that ground already. But this is a very small complaint in what I thought was an excellent movie overall.This got a LOT of unwarranted poor reviews right out of the box. Don't believe them. Most of the reviews led me to two conclusions. 1) They based their review off the trailer or a synopsis of the film or just watched ten minutes and then left the screening room. Or, 2) The film did not affirm their love everyone and tolerate everything else ethos that Star Trek has been making out with for decades now. All hail the Prime Directive. Or not. Hey. Let's try that, instead.As the Empress of The Terran Empire Philippa Georgious would say, let's get messy. Draw your own conclusions.

reviews.title: Star Trek: Section 31
reviews.content: Paramount announced a Section 31 Star Trek series several years ago. All about the amoral secret black ops division of Starfleet.It would be a starring vehicle for Michelle Yeoh who plays genocidal Empress Philippa Georgiou in the mirror universe. She somehow ended up in Starfleet where she was the captain of the USS Discovery that got killed.Once Yeoh won the best actress Oscar, the plans for the series went. Paramount retooled it as an one off film, maybe a recurring franchise.This is a cheap knockoff Mission Impossible/Dirty Dozen/Suicide Squad hybrid. TheSection 31 members and former Philippa Georgiou look for a stolen doomsday weapon called the Godsend. There may also be a saboteur in the team.The film is bogged down by a lazy plot. The most uninspiring members of the black ops team. Their introduction and attempts at humour was so ham fisted, I nearly switched off.

reviews.title: Oh dear....
reviews.content: I can hear the heads rolling down the paramount studios corridors as I write this, and rightly so.Feels like it was written by kids with zero knowledge or love of Star Trek.Empty, cliche ridden tripe. No character building or back stories. No clever witty dialogue or interesting plot turns. No genuine chemistry between the characters. Utterly dull and predictable storyline. Who at Paramount read this script and thought, 'yes, this is what the Star Trek universe and its fans deserve'. ?!?Michelle Yeoh did her best with what she was given but she was never going to be able to save this mess. And the other characters are 100% forgettable. I finished the movie 10 minutes ago and I couldn't tell you a single one of their names.The worst Star Trek movie by a long long way. It makes Star Trek V: The Final Frontier look like a cinematic masterpiece by comparison. It definitely goes where no Star Trek movie has gone before. Straight to the trash can.Paramount, if you are listening. No movie is better than a terrible movie. It should never have even been released.

reviews.title: Critics said this is the worse Trek movie but-
reviews.content:
Hear me out, anything the critics said mean the movie is a really good one to watch, this is actually enjoyable for both Trek fans, people who hates Star Trek but love action plus Sci-Fi films, and people who love Michelle Yeoh films.Is it the "WORSE" Trek film ever? No, don't listen to the critics and the haters, Star Trek: Section 31 was originally a series, got rewritten as a movie, I am hoping we will get a sequel movie.The movie was really fun to watch, lots of action, a lot of references within the Trek lore, and Michelle Yeoh as the emperor always being a bada**!I would watch this again!Movie rating:
9/10.

reviews.title: Truly unbelievably bad
reviews.content: I thought the terpid discovery with Uber human Michael birnbaum was terrible. That begat the equally horrible first two seasons of Picard, which begat the so-so Strange New Worlds. Now the terrible idea less 'creator' Kurtzman (I often visualize him sitting in a cave ala apocalypse now, cackling and mumbling, how much further can I destroy Star Trek?) drops this bomb, taking one of DS9s finest ideas and using it like toilet paper. Nonsense story, truly terrible acting, yes, even Michelle Yeoh seems like she's about to choke on the lines she spouts. None of the characters or this 'story' are memorable in any way. The story meanders from one silly situation to the next. Other than the mention of Starfleet, this doesn't feel like Star Trek at all. Just a futuristic heist movie. 95 minutes of my life gone. Too bad it felt like 395. PS: a Vulcan Android years before data is discovered? And he has a Scottish accent? I'm surprised someone took credit for writing this trash.

reviews.title: Fun space adventure
reviews.content: They should titled it "A Section 31 Adventure". It was a fun space adventure. It was an event in the life of the former emperor Georgiou; it had a mix of spy and action filled with a good fun adventure in the 23rd century. It didn't really mess with canon with those that worry about stuff like that and it centered on work outside the Federation so one got crazy with bending Starfleet protocol. It did well for a series that kept getting chopped down to ultimately and essentially a TV movie for streaming. It was a fun adventure in the style of an episode with a bigger budget, though some of the dialogue was predictable, the cast appeared to have good chemistry.

reviews.title: Disappointed!
reviews.content: As a lieflong fan of the Trek universe, I was really looking forward to this "made for TV" movie and had high hopes for it. Sadly it has left me very disappointed. It does not have the splendour of the motion pictures and neither does it have the charm of any of the TV series. The only thing that holds it together at all is Michelle Yeoh. Without her, this would barely be any better than some of the Fan Films. There is no other "star" power to help pull this movie along or even the odd appearance of the occasional recognisable Trek star. As such, the vibe was more of a Star Wars one than a Trek one with considerably worse CGI that felt like a throwback to the 80s. The story was weak and predictable and not even up to the standard of "Discovery" (not one of favourite series anyway) despite being penned by three of the writers from the first series of that show. Overall, it felt low budget. I have reluctantly scored this as a "6" but would have given it "5.5" if I could. It is better than a "5" purely based on Michelle Yeoh's performance (nobody else had an ounce of her acting chops). This is from someone who gave TNG "9" to give you an idea of the scale of my disillusionment. I sincerely hope this is not an indication of the direction the franchise is going to take. Because, if it is, it will surely die . . .

reviews.title: A different Trek
reviews.content: This is a unique Trek movie. It will annoy a lot of Trekkies, however when you scratch the surface it belongs in the pantheon of Trek, and will definitely deserve rewatches.The good - it expands on the Georgiou character and background - showing where she came from and developing on the depth she had during Discovery, also the introduction of some good new characters. It looks and sounds fantastic - amazing set design, special effects and makeup. The story is interesting and is a bit Mission Impossible but in Trek. As ever, direction is top notch, as are the fight scenes.The bad - some of the characters fall very flat, and the "banter"/sniping at each other wears very thin very fast. The team introduction screen in clunky and was clearly written for the Original TV series. The final scene is a bit too much TV/sequel baiting. Some of the characters are not given enough time to grown beyond their one dimension trope.Worth a watch, and I hope we get more but having ironed out the characterisation issues.

reviews.title: Trek by Temu
reviews.content: This is bad, it's not Star Trek and it's certainly not Section 31. To be fair people worked on this "thing" and they probably tried hard... maybe. But this seemed to have been done by people who don't know Trek or at least don't care about it. It would've been nice to see a seedy and gritty CIA style of story where Section 31 interferes with the romulan government or something like that.This was just bad and lazy and insulting to people who like Star Trek. Using legacy characters for no reason and mentioning the eugenics wars just to mention it is lazy and cheap. This feels like Temu or Ali express started to make Star Trek.

reviews.title: I've watched Star Trek for 33 years and loved it!
reviews.content: There are a lot of people whining "it's not Star Trek" and it's not, it's Section 31. I actually really liked the movie and thought it was better than anything in the Kelvin timeline. It wasn't supposed to be a traditional Trek story because Section 31 is anything but traditional Star Trek. I think overall the acting was pretty good and the character development for such a short movie was on point. The action did seem forced at times but I thought it was a good story and enjoyed the TV movie for what it was... A TV movie! Too many people get stuck in this narrow mold of what Star trek should or should not be. Maybe just try enjoying the story for what it is. Anyway, personally, I'd love to see future stories about Section 31 and hope this isn't the last of them.

reviews.title: Nope....just nope.
reviews.content: This could have worked better as a series. Tbe only thing that reminds us that this is a star trek movie is the reference of Starfleet but even the starships do not look "Treky" Too focused on action scenes -most of them unnecessary - and it actually doesn't tell us anything about section 31 as an organisation. It's more of a movie about Emperor Georgiou than anything else.The only thing that elevates this movie is the visuals and the very good performance of Yeoh.It should have been a 2 parter in discovery or its own series. As a movie it doesn't give us any insight at the other characters and the story is very simple.

reviews.title: Critics Need To Get Head Checked
reviews.content: Honestly, I found the movie quite enjoyable. All these critics, with their fancy degrees and pretentious pronouncements, seem to think their opinions are gospel. Newsflash: they're just opinions! I thought Star Trek: Section 31 had a genuinely original plot.Maybe these die-hard fans just crave the same old, same old. If you're a true Star Trek fan, you'll appreciate its fresh take. But if you're stuck in the past, still clinging to the glory days of the original series (no offense to the elderly), you might want to steer clear.Firstly, the movie masterfully delves into the gray areas of morality. Section 31, with its morally ambiguous methods, forces viewers to question the very nature of duty and sacrifice. It challenges the classic Star Trek ideals of unwavering optimism and peaceful exploration, presenting a more nuanced and realistic view of the universe. This exploration of ethical dilemmas is a hallmark of great Star Trek storytelling, and the movie delivers on that front with thought-provoking scenarios that will stay with you long after the credits roll.Secondly, the production values are top-notch. From the stunning visuals and intricate set designs to the thrilling action sequences and captivating score, the movie is a feast for the senses. The special effects are seamlessly integrated into the narrative, enhancing the immersive experience and transporting you to the depths of space. It's clear that a tremendous amount of care and attention to detail went into crafting this cinematic masterpiece, and it shows in every frame.

reviews.title: 2 stars because Michelle Yeoh is the reason it's not getting 1 star
reviews.content: I don't get this. The writers are Star Trek writers. The production team is Trek as well, so why does this feel like any generic sci-fi movie? The first 5 minutes were true Trek, showing the harsh landscape of the Terran Empire. But then you've got a Mission Impossible style beginning. Then, too much character exposition and dialogue from the 31 team. And can someone please sue the non-irish dialogue coach!! All that was missing was a shillelagh and a 'begorah'.Action doesn't equal Trek. The ideal of betterment and the human condition and experience seen through different lenses is Trek. Just look at the Pike speech from season 2 episode 1. You can still have a rip-roaring time and action sequences. Michelle Yeoh, still brilliant. But what they gave her.....damn! Please do better people, or you may well doom the franchise. The only saving grace is that it's on streaming and not on cinema wide release. If it was it would've tanked!

reviews.title: Someone told AI to create Star Trek by Disney
reviews.content: I thought only Star Wars was captured by Disney, but now it seems they also made a Star Trek movie.The movie would be a single episode long if they wouldn't explain every obvious thing in detail all the time.The characters are awful crafted. Just like in these "parodies" (whrere they all love each others very much *winkwink).Never expected that section 31 would be a clown show instead of a special Starfleet unit.The longer you watch it, the more brain cells you lose. Don't worry if you watched several cat videos on Tiktok during the movie, they'll explain what you missed every 15 minutes with nice flashbacks. So you can follow the "story" even when you're brain dead.The visuals are nice but cheap. Reminds me of some low budged independent creations 10 years ago.It's okay maybe, if you don't expect Star Trek.

reviews.title: The underdogs of section 31
reviews.content: A lot of people are complaining that it's not the typical Star Trek. I don't get it, since it's a Section 31 movie, it's kinda obvious it won't be like the classic series. The real issue for me is the Section 31 team, they feel more like a bunch of misfits than a group of badass spies. The biggest issue for me is that, while the idea of underdogs in Section 31 is interesting, the characters didn't quite live up to the potential. Could this be a TV series? Absolutely, but they need to flesh out the characters.Overall, it's a departure from the classic Star Trek formula, and while it could have been better, it's still worth a watch."

reviews.title: I might buy the DVD, just so I can burn it with fire
reviews.content: WTAF. Truly awful. Georgiou was the best thing to come out of Discovery and they reward her with this wet fart of a film.Poorly written fanfic. Ridiculous characters. Constant annoying jokes to mask the lack of quality dialogue. One guy looks like a Borg humped humped a Lego set. CGI is generic and bland. And the lens flares will burn your retinas, like looking down the business end of a phaser and pulling the trigger.Your time would be better spent watching Tribbles multiply.If I had a hand in creating this I'd stick my head in the warp core and turn it up to 9.9.Make it so ... it never happend.

reviews.title: Paramount did this on purpose!
reviews.content: Michelle Yeoh, ROCKS!!!!Paramount did not want this to succeed. Let's start with the opening sequence, 35 second, could have been created by a 12 year old. No opening credits.Once they find Georgiou, dialog, jokes, some of the casting, not great, except for the main characters who end up together. Stuff happens. Mixture of good and bad writing and acting.Back story for Georgiou. Fight, chase,Paramount went cheap on the outdoor set, it could have been the budget, someone with no imagination. Just plane old fire shooting up from the ground, nothing to disguise it, oh look fire shooting up from the ground.I do not know what changed, the chemistry between the main characters melded together. Then it happened, it got better fast, and held my attention,This like all the other Star Trek Series, and Movies, started off being ridiculed, TOS, almost did not air at all. Voyager, because there was a female captain, some of the casting.Everyone has an opinion, good bad, or indifferent.Paramount needs to throw money at this, get more Star Trek writers. Give it a nice open sequence, even Star Trek the Animated series from 1973, had a longer intro, with credits.Yes, I would love to see another movie, or even a series.

reviews.title: Startrek no.
reviews.content: As it is, this sucked. It didn't do anything interesting with the setting, it didn't have a story that could only be told in a Star Trek setting, and it didn't even do all that much with Section 31 as an idea. I'm glad this was never a full season of TV, as was originally planned, because eight hours of this would have been a nightmare and I would be disappointed if it was . The whole show was predicable. I am in hopes that this show is not allowed to continue. It is a "middle finger" up to the Star Trek community/fans..shame. I would not and will not referw anyone to watch this movie it is really bad.

reviews.title: The Acolyte Meets Rebel Moon Meets Spock's Brain
reviews.content: Encounter at Farpoint was one of the most awkward, if not the most excruciating episodes of Trek to watch. At least it was reasonably free of flashbacks. Maybe the Section 31 movie would have been a great pilot episode in retrospect. Maybe Section 31 would have been the next great Trek series.The Spock's brain part of my headline is an inside joke you'll need to see for yourself.I at least finished it. I couldn't finish Rebel Moon. It has a similarly spectacular adolescence to it with explosions, fights, and interruptions for badass posturing and slow-mo walks.The visual effects were superb. The score was superb.The Acolyte used so many flashbacks it felt as if the DIsney production crew were pressed to reduce costs by re-using footage. Not the case here.I suppose the biggest challenge I have is watching a reasonably well thought out season-long story arc with so much original content crammed into 90 minutes that burns 30 minutes of it being expository.

reviews.title: I am a Star Trek fan. But what was that?
reviews.content: This is review is not to alert other viewers. There are enough of those. This is to Paramount.Having watched every Star Trek episode and movie, with exception of the animated series, I did not react when Discovery portrayed the Klingons as pustules in uniform . Nor did respond when Voyager's Janeway and Chakotay devolved into giant salamanders , had offspring and then were re-evolved. But Section 31. Really? I could not tell what parts were serious drama or from the parts that were supposed to be humorous.The difficult thing here is comparing it to other Star Treks when the only direct comparison I can think of, is to "Plan 9 From Outer Space". How so? To start with when adjusted for inflation (or maybe not) the production budget must be the same. When thinking about Section 31's direction editing and special effects we may reach the conclusion that Ed Woods is alive, well and working at paramount.I love Star Trek. I want more Star Trek. But please, Paramount throw Section 31 away.

reviews.title: O tempora, o mores!
reviews.content: In this review I want to tell you, why I did not like it.First of all, the production design. Most sets look rediclious and somehow revamped sets from other shows. Then they ripped out the flame throwers of Discovery's bridge and planted them across the on location planet set. Did I like some of it? Yes, the interior and exterior design of the bad guy ship. Although the spinning thing in the background of the bridge looked like a disco ball.The costumes are over the top.The plot is over the top, another doomdays device, this time a quadrant, a quarter of the galaxy. That is a new scale.The writing is bad, the dialogue stupid and it has a lot of curse words. Here is an example of why the writing is bad: Georgiou wants to steal something, so she has a device with which she puts herself and the thing she wants to steal out of phase. So the owner of the thing/Mcguffin cannot touch the thing anymore and he cannot shoot Georgiou, since both are out of phase. So Georgiou can take the thing she wants and leave savely. Good plan, right? So far, so good. But, the moment she leaves, there are her friends and knock the owner out anyway. So why phase out in the first place? Suddenly someone new appears and wants to steal the thing. And surprise. He is out of phase too. What a coincidence. Now Georgiou and new guy fight and nobody can help her, because both are out of phase. Question, why not turn of the phasing device? To quote the Drinker: "Don't know." So they fight on, chase each other through walls until a foot of Georgiou is stuck in a wall, because...? Now new guy can take the device and escape. Now the foot is free. Wow, did anybody read this before shooting, did nobody raise a hand and say: What does God need with a starship?The acting is also bad, and I do not know why everybody always praises Michelle Yeoh, she has always been so bad in the role of mirror Georgiou. The rest is not much better. A not-Vulcan who speaks with an Irish or Scottish accent, cannot tell the difference, but it is stupid. Then we have a Cameltoeid, a Deltan, an Augment, and Rachel Gareth. The only one I liked, actingwise and characterwise was the bad guy.All in all, that was really bad and not worth anybody's time.

reviews.title: I did not hate it, but I did not like it either.
reviews.content: It did not feel like a movie. It felt like a particularly violent two parter episode of Discovery, with incredibly shaky camera work.Immediately didn't feel like Star Trek when it began with her murdering her family, but I suppose that's on brand for Georgiou. The intro with the Section 31 computer voice that sounded like a Majel Barrett impersonator was pretty bad. I don't like how they just introduced the whole supporting cast in Georgiou's big expositional conversation with the Section 31 guy. The scene that followed was even more contrived as it introduced all the characters' unique quirks.Now about all those characters...Michelle Yeoh gave a great performance as Georgiou, but I think most of us can agree this character has been taken as far as she should go. It's time to move past all the death and torture.The Section 31 leader actually really nailed the moral ambiguity of the organization. He was a little one note but ultimately a decent character.The shapeshifter was actually pretty cool. I like Sam Richardson, so I'm glad they gave him a good character. He was relatable to what I might be like in those situations.The Deltan died pretty quickly, so I don't have much of an opinion. Probably for the best, since Deltans are kind of a problematic species.Space Daria (Rachel Garrett) was alright despite not being written with much of a personality. I like that actress, and she nailed the part written for her.The guy in the Vulcan suit was just a wonky alien of the week, and his whole gimmick was that he was the opposite of a Vulcan. I'll admit the betrayal took me by surprise.The guy in the other mech suit was actually annoying in a funny way, so I kind of have mixed feelings on him.San was a pretty cringey villain, who just never got over a broken heart and became delusional with his idea of "righteous mercy". Also the gimp suit was kind of weird, but that's not as important.So him being the villain raises some more questions about time travel. How exactly was he in the Lost Era when that's not when he and Georgiou are from? How did he know exactly what time to travel to in order to find her?I liked a few scenes, but not many...I liked the scene where they were solving the mech guy's murder. I definitely didn't see it coming when his suit was hacked to kill him. And the tiny weirdo being the traitor took me by surprise as well.The sets are pretty cool, although as usual they were too dark. I dug the space station with the wildly impractical design. The bar was pretty cool too, although it felt kind of like it was from Farscape. The ships at least felt very Star Trek. The costumes were 50/50.There are way too many fight scenes. Also a lot of torture. And as with everything about Section 31, there's a lot of overpowered technology mysteriously never makes its way into anyone else's hands in the future.Admittedly it was cool learning more about Terran politics, and Georgiou's backstory. Kind of weird they seemed to imply the Terran empire wasn't as messed up before Georgiou, when we've clearly seen that it was already just as bad in Enterprise.It makes me nervous that the end felt like it was setting up a sequel. I want to see the franchise go in another direction.

reviews.title: Like a retro version
reviews.content: I really enjoyed the movie ,purely for the reason that it was nothing like a total CGI Star Trek. It had a mix of cranky crazed characters,with a bizarre storyline as though it was not scripted but still enjoyable. Sets had a gritty basic design and put me in mind of Gerry Anderson of Thunderbird fame. All in all it looked like a production from channel 4,but it kept active for the whole duration and I got the impression it was made as a programme ratings filler.I absolutely adore Michelle Yeah playing her part with a cheeky hidden smirk. If you expected another tested formula scrip( have they not become repetitious and stale with the TV series) expect something just fun.

reviews.title: Embarrassingly bad
reviews.content: Good news for Star Trek V: That film is no longer the worst Star Trek movie. More good news: Section 31 will not be a tv show that completist fans will have to endure just because it has the Star Trek label. I am a huge Star Trek fan, but Discovery was a disappointment, and this offshoot is even worse.I don't expect modern Trek to match my favorites like the original series, TNG, DS9, and even Voyager. But Lower Decks, Prodigy, and Strange New Worlds are excellent, and there is still great stories and ideas to explore.I came in with low expectations, but this is a genuine travesty. It's not just the worst Trek, it's the worst movie I've seen in years.The writing is terrible. The acting abysmal. The jokes don't work. There is no character to like or care about. It's like watching AI-generated content, in which every aspect of the input parameters are direct-to-video sci-fi movies and the worst bits of Discovery.

reviews.title: Star Trek - IMF - Oceans 11
reviews.content: Not that bad. Fun, but not exciting, I wouldn't be opposed to a sequel, as long as the story is a bit better.There were too many themes lifted from other genres that made it messy and disjointed. This made it feel like a mash up, kinda like an early 00s comedy movie, but serious and SyFy. Two of the characters were too over the top and predictable spoiling some of story.With Strange New Worlds as the main Star Trek series and Lower Decks ending its run I'd expect better writing.What they did well was the CGI, background on Phillipa, and adding a race back in that hasn't been seen since V'ger.All that said, I did enjoy it and will likely watch it again which more than I can say for others I've watched recently.

reviews.title: It's not Star Trek
reviews.content: This movie is not about Star Trek.I had a little hope, because when the topic was addressed in Deep Spece 9 and Voyager we had some good episodes.But...It is not an action movie, it is not a spy movie, it is not a drama, what is this movie?I can't say what it is exactly but like Discovery it's just a terrible entertainment experience.I have nothing against the actors and their respective performances, but they could do NOTHING with this horrible script.Unfortunately for Star Trek fans, Gene Roddenberry's memory and work has once again been thrown in the trash. I sincerely hope that the Alex Kurtzman era ends with this film.

reviews.title: The Franchise Hits Warp Speed... Into a Dumpster Fire
reviews.content: Ah, Star Trek: Section 31. A movie so profoundly unnecessary that even die-hard Trekkies are probably wondering if this was some kind of tax write-off.Paramount, in their infinite wisdom, decided to take one of the most nuanced, morally complex aspects of Trek lore-the shady espionage wing of Starfleet-and throw it into the creative equivalent of a blender filled with fireworks, plot holes, and Michael Bay DVDs.The result? An unholy cocktail of noise, explosions, and groan-worthy dialogue that's about as Star Trek as a Monster Truck rally held on Vulcan.Star Trek fans deserve better.Let's just agree to jettison this one into the nearest sun and never speak of it again.

reviews.title: This show is bad all around
reviews.content: No spoilers, but this show is just bad. Michelle Yeoh has done some fine work before, but not on Star Trek, in any iteration. Here she is just phoning it in. It is like Paramount promised her a TV series of her own, then renegged by giving her this as a consolation prize, and then she is just reading lines. The writers must have been unpaid interns. They did spend some money on affects, but they probably used the resources for the other Star Trek show since they are doing the 3rd season. No fans asked for this so I guess this is for non Star Trek fans?. Some reviews are saying "this is so not Trek". Then why put it in the Trek universe and call it Star Trek? The use of the IP for personal fan fiction is so obvious. Bad acting, bad writing, worsens the IP of Star Trek.

reviews.title: Written by a 12 year old who has never seen star trek
reviews.content: Seriously, what an earth was this about? Clearly written by people who knew nothing about Star Trek canon or who are very keen on making sure Star Trek dies. Never before has a film been so eagerly anticipated and been so unbelievably and catastrophically disappointing. The plot was appalling. The characters-WTF. A Vulcan with an Irish accent. A bloke with a suit of armour on. A Deltan who lasts two minutes. A tiny creature who has 100000 offspring. There were a couple of attempts to be Star Trek. But none of the real genius that was behind Picard season three. It's shocking that they put Gene Roddenberry in as a writing credit as I am sure he would be spinning in his grave at this appalling attempt. If we never see another Star Trek movie, we know why. This was made by a bunch of 12-year-olds who were obviously given a camera and too much budget for special effects. Nothing on this film was special.

reviews.title: It"s not that bad.
reviews.content:
Having recently rewarched Abrams trilogy I didn't find it nearly as bad as I thought it would. It was a new take on Star Trek and I liked the whole Suicide Squad vibe. With 13 movies already I actually wanted this one to be different and it was. Couldn't care less for the love story but action was good, it looked good, sound was big. Beginning was a bit troubling but they get right into it after. But it was a bit anti climactic at the end. The fight sequence was a tad bit too long. Can see why this was better put in a one off movie rather than a 1 season series.Sound 8/10
Visuals 8/10
Story 5/10
Casting 8/10
Dialogue 5/10
Acting 7/10.

reviews.title: Expected more
reviews.content: I am disappointed that a great actor is wasted. Of course her acting is great, as is the acting of most of the others. Also the effects are great.However this is just a bad movieVery thin plotFull of clichesFightscenses are to longTo much explaining (which I understand is needed, but please, show instead of talk)Tried to be funny and failed most of the timesEverything is so predictable.I liked the mirror part of Discovery a lot. So I was looking forward to this movie. But the mirror part does not line up with what I know of the mirror universe. Becoming an emporer of the terran empire by doing tests in a competition? Descending from a poor family living in tents? That does not make sense.And now there is gateway between universes? Just simple fly from one universe to the other.But my biggest gripe is the same as with all the latest Star Trek movies. It is al about revenge and a mighty weapon.Please try to be original.Still a 5 (and not lower) because of Michelle Yeoh.

reviews.title: Please remove Star Trek from that movie title
reviews.content: This is not just a boring and surprisingly bad movie that makes no sense, this has NOTHING to do with Star Trek. I see copied elements and scenes from Dune, Star Wars etc. - but nothing from the Star Trek feeling. So I'm wondering: why this movie? It seem they even tried to avoid any connection to the Star Trek world, after a while I realized: that is actually good.This movie is pretty much like the uninspired Rebel Moon trash. They picked elements that worked somewhere else and put them together somehow.It gets worst when they try to be funny - like every 2 minutes. Than I feel pure pain.The movie doesn't work, it will get the worst rating of all Star Trek movies, no doubt.

reviews.title: Has flaws, but I could overlook some of them.
reviews.content: Character development of the team, doesn't exist and there is no real explanation of what section 31 is or does. Director could have done a better job and if there is any sequel they need to seriously look at who they hire.as the next director . Low budget still could work if computer voices were done better and time was taken to develop more of team members to give it more of the Star Trek universe rhythm. The story had small gaps and those gaps made me uncomfortable.Michelle Yeoh was excellent and her acting is what pulled this movie into an acceptable level. I was amazed at her fight sequences. And some of the special effects were pretty good. I loved the inphase/out of phase scenes. And a bonus character at the very end made me smile.My rating is generous, because I would like to see sequels.

reviews.title: Don't believe the bad 1 reviews
reviews.content:
I'm a trek fan for 40 years. I've watched them all many times .This fits perfectly in the parallel universe part of trek way back in Enterprise . Michelle Yo was amazing then and is amazing now. The story is good it builds and builds has plenty of action and action it even has a lovely story intertwined. Enjoy.

reviews.title: Tornado
reviews.content: To be honest, I was really quite disappointed with this. It all centres around the search for some stolen gold that has been re-stolen and hidden by "Tornado", the partner in a father/daughter Japanese puppetry show that is touring the shires of late 18th century Britain. The gold was originally acquired by "Sugar" (Tim Roth) and his gang but as they stopped to watch the show, it was re-acquired by an opportunist urchin (Nathan Malone) whilst he was being watched by "Tornado" (K√¥ki). When the gang discover it's missing, all hell breaks loose and so she hides the loot and the boy in their wagon and off they go. It doesn't take long for the men to put two and two together and they set after the slow-moving visitors and a rather dishonourable encounter ensues. Meantime, "Little Sugar" (Jack Lowden) is tired of taking orders from his old man and has plans of his own to secure the cash - and that's bound to lead to a conflict with his no-nonsense father. So now we have a brute chasing his money, a son looking for change and a samurai-trained woman out for revenge. It has the ingredients of a good adventure. Sadly, though, she is just not a very convincing actor, there is far too much meandering around the countryside setting and re-setting the scenario and there is a real paucity of pace here. It can't have had an huge budget, but that needn't have mattered if the the story had taken a little longer to develop a little more depth to the characters. It's all too episodic and though it does mix the timelines a little to break up the narrative, there are too many characters who appear then add little before we move on. It does create an overall sense of a fairly poverty-stricken and lawless rural life, but once we hit the home straight it all just takes a predictable path to it's conclusion. Nobody is really used to full effect here and though the bleakness is conveyed well enough, the story doesn't really deliver.

reviews.title: Seems like it was written by someone who'd never met another person.
reviews.content: I watch a lot of movies but don't choose to write many reviews and prefer to leave that to more opinionated people. But this "movie" just begged in every way to be called out. After 90 grueling minutes I came to the conclusion that this movie was written and directed by people who had never actually met other human beings. Not a single line of dialog, interaction, decision or behavior seemed like anything normal people do. Every moment of character interaction felt so fake and lacked any connection to reality making the viewer's experience more like extended torture. There was not 1 likeable character and even the child was nerve gratingly annoying. There was no real plot and most staged scenes felt like they were done on no budget and used CGI to augment the missing elements but failed at every attempt. The fight/combat scenes were laughable jokes with nobody apparently able to fake actual impact. But I did get a big laugh at how the main "hero" (reminding me of Hudson of Hudson & Rex) completely abandons his family and doesn't even seem to care to think of them while the world is supposedly falling apart and he's doing his action hero schtick... badly. This movie feels like it was an overreach by everyone involved and they tried to fill in all the gaps in post with really bad fx work. But for me it didn't work in any way and was more anger inducing than entertaining.

reviews.title: Overall, it is an enjoyable movie, not as scary as I thought.
reviews.content: The story starts with a short disaster, then cuts to the story from the vacation in Thailand. There is a show of various tourist attractions, followed by the cause of the disaster, which is the gates of hell opened by the villain. The father must do everything possible to help the family, the mother must fight for her child, and the daughter must try to be strong and not be shocked. The monk who came to help because he knew the whole story.Overall, it is an enjoyable movie, not as scary as I thought. The story is not as concise as it should be. There is too much explanation of the cause and effect related to the game, which I personally do not play the game, so I am not interested in this part. But I like the creation of various ghosts and demons in an interesting way. I just wish the ghosts with fire had a bigger role. From what I have read in the details, it is a movie that did not use a high budget, so it can be said that it was done well and made it worth the budget.

reviews.title: Atrocious acting.
reviews.content: After reading what the movie was about, I was excited to watch it. I'm prone to Morrone and his acting now so I paid him little attention, but I just want to ask. I don't usually stray from big movie productions cause of this same reason and it came to bite me in the back once again. I want back my 30 mins.üò©

reviews.title: Very nice action/horror
reviews.content: I was pretty shocked when I came to look at the score for this movie. It's Much much better than the ratings suggest. The dialogue is not best at times, this is true, but if you can get past that, and if you like horror/sci-fi/action movies, you should really like this one. reviews.title: It's fine
reviews.content: The movie is ok, not great, but definitely not terrible. The dialogue could use some improvement (maybe they were referencing the game, but I never played it, so I have no idea), and there was too much going on for a 90 minute movie, but there are some cool action scenes and things moves quickly for most of the movie (some lulls). The actors were believable enough, the little girl was cute, and the bad guy definitely pulled off being creepy crazy with that doll. Overall, an ok sci-fi horror action movie that kept me mostly entertained for 90 minutes. Improve the dialogue, keep the storyline simpler, and I think it could have been even more enjoyable, but it's fine as is.

reviews.title: Diabolical!
reviews.content: I never thought anything would top Blair Witch Project as the worst horror ever, but Home Sweet Home has knocked it out of the park. This has to be the worst horror movie I have ever tried to watch, and I say tried because I gave up after 30 minutes.It is frustrating beyond measure. The first showdown between the cop and a shooter in a mall told me all I needed to know about where this movie was headed with its intentions. That was confirmed by the cop's numerous run-ins with a woman/demon who constantly stalks him, trying to kill him, and yet every time he has her at his mercy, he runs away from her without finishing her off... It's WTF inexplicable, and I'm struggling to think of another film so bad in this respect. The wife is almost as stupid, too.Besides having a poor cast, shocking acting, and terrible writing, this movie is amateurish and lazy. It's like watching fan fiction.

reviews.title: International Bad Acting
reviews.content: What happens when you gather an international cast of bad actors, hand them a poor script, throw in some cheesy special effects and direct it like you just don't care, well you get this film. There's the annoying child, the plot that makes me believe this is a sequel because I barely understood what was going on, lots of fire and smoke, violence and all of it was so boring I kept nodding off. There is no character to care about. They're all one dimensional almost cartoonish characters and it's as if someone thought just throwing in lots of CGI was enough to call it a finished movie. This deserves every bad review it gets.

reviews.title: Decent movie but
reviews.content: The story, effects were very good. Most of the acting was good. However the biggest let down was the lead. This movie would have been much better served with a better casted lead character.He started off ok. However as the movie progressed his acting kept falling short more and more. He seemed forced, fake, trying too hard.I do not know ow if I have seen him else where and this doesn't mean he can't or hasn't done better. But this was definitely a failure. The supporting acting, including the little girl was better.If the actor sees this please take it as a positive criticism on how to improve. It is not meant to demean you.

reviews.title: OMG! Some YouTube trailers can be so deceiving!
reviews.content: I wonder... How much were the actors paid for this movie? A large portion of it must've gone to the special fx; I'd say because the acting was bad, the script so bland, scene editing so wrong and the characters are annoying to watch!I looked the title up because of the impressive trailer seen on YouTube, and I should've just left it at that! I wanted to see how damaged Bangkok would be during the tragedy, but the lead characters and even their extras were so laidback throughout their acting. Come to think of it, there was no logic for this story to be produced at all.I should've just stick to Thai horror movies which gives more scare than this!

reviews.title: Terrible Acting/Amateur Director
reviews.content: Sit down and enjoy a cup of tea while chaos erupts outside-a war zone, or worse, a bus surrounded by zombies. Yet somehow, the characters speak gently and sit calmly as if nothing's happening. The acting falls far short; it feels more like a stage play than a movie, with dialogue delivered as if they're reading from a script.The only two stars I'd give are for the cinematography and the music. The sound and special effects are decent, and I hope the crew got paid fairly for their work. Unfortunately, many shots felt like filler-scenes that served no purpose except to pad out the runtime.One example: a character chooses to climb over a car instead of just walking around it, even though the road is wide open. It feels forced and unrealistic. The director could definitely use a few more lessons on how to guide actors into more natural performance.

reviews.title: Watchable, but forgettable...
reviews.content: I was not familiar with this 2025 movie titled "Home Sweet Home: Rebirth" prior to sitting down to watch it. And not knowing anything about the movie, I harbored zero expectations. But I will say that I found the movie's cover/poster interesting enough to actually draw my attention.Initially I had thought that this movie was a sequel or something, given the 'rebirth' part of the title, but that was apparently not the case. Turns out that it was apparently based on a game.The storyline in the movie was simplistic, almost to the point of being non-existing. Sure, it made for a fair enough viewing experience, but just don't expect to be using your brain during the 93 minutes that the movie ran for.I was not familiar with the cast ensemble in the movie, a thing that I actually enjoy whenever I sit down to watch a movie. And the acting performances in the movie were fair, despite the fact that the actors and actresses had surprisingly little material to work with.Visually then the movie was good. I definitely liked the special effects in the movie, though while looking good they hardly did much of anything to add to the lacking storyline."Home Sweet Home: Rebirth" is the type of movie that you watch once, and forget about within the coming 24 hours. Yeah, there just wasn't sufficient contents to the script or storyline to make this a memorable movie. And it most definitely is not a movie that you will sit down and watch a second time.Watchable, sure, but a very forgettable movie at best.My rating of directors Steffen Hacker and Alexander Kiesl's 2025 movie lands on a generous five out of ten stars.

reviews.title: Not even that bad
reviews.content: Reading these reviews made me not really wanna watch, considering I had been waiting ages for the release, but I decided to make my own judgement and it's really not as bad as people put out. Decide for yourself. Yes, the acting was slightly questionable but it's not the worst, and overall it was quite enjoyable. Michele played a good villain, The child was sweet and the mother wasn't so bad. Jake, good, sometimes he overacted but I don't believe it was really as bad as people are making it out to be. They had high expectations due to the trailer but as I said, make your own judgement, it's REALLY not that bad.

reviews.title: Absoluty amazing film !!!

reviews.title: Mek nailed it! üî•
reviews.content: I just watched Home Sweet Home: Rebirth and wow-I'm still thinking about it! As a big fan of Michele Morrone, I was really excited to see him play the villain, and he absolutely nailed it. He brought this dark, intense energy to Mek that gave me chills (in the best way).The story pulls you right in-a mix of supernatural horror, action, and emotional moments. reviews.title: I wish I was blind after watching this movie
reviews.content: I don't even know if this can be called a movie. What is this garbage? From the acting to the plot, the characters, the writing, I wouldn't even dare to call this a kids' movie. Kids' movies are way more fun to watch and at least have decent acting and a clear point to the story. But this? This is on another level of awfulness.The only somewhat decent character was the wife. She acted weird at times, too, but at least she felt like the only human in this mess. Even that little girl was annoying. I have seen a lot of young girls or boys who are way more talented.
