Reuniting with director Nick Love, Dyer delivers a powerhouse performance as Jack Jones, a coked-up football hooligan with a heart buried beneath the chaos. His charisma lights up the screen, blending razor-sharp humor with raw emotion that keeps you hooked. Dyer's knack for owning every scene-whether he's breaking the fourth wall or sparring with his on-screen wife-makes this a standout. It's gritty, it's loud, and it's a love letter to Dyer's larger-than-life persona. A must-see for fans and anyone craving a bold, British gem!

reviews.title: Hilarious fun with a little bit of unsubtle social commentary
reviews.content: 2 min agoI watched this movie and it is hilarious particularly for any working class person that understands the social division between the liberal middle class and the working class. There are some very unsubtle digs at the liberal middle that hopefully has them squirming in their seats. Classism is the last prejudice untackled in legislation in the UK and needs addressing. Not just the crude Marxist Classism but a more complex look at contemporary class prejudice in the UK that also squarely puts the fair share of the blame on the middle class in their complicity in allowing the powerful to demonise and exploit the working class since the 1990s. However, this film is primarily just a great comedy with excellent performances, but also with some funny, unsubtle and sadly accurate social commentary too. Watch it now in cinemas you c***

reviews.title: Marching Powder
reviews.content: This film was very carefully put together. In particular how Danny talked into the camera. Simply put I bloody loved it and just came back from the cinema. Defiantly one for the collection. Parts of the story I think most lads that age can relate to parts of it. A coming of age Jack the lad loads of humor. It had a mix of everything. Although it's funny there is parts which are serious to. Men being men and not really wanting to grow up and accept there responsibilities. I do think there is room for a sequel especially with the son. A spin off movie. Ten out ten for meI'd love to see a extended cut as well.

reviews.title: "Just finishing my Cathedral"
reviews.content: "Just finishing my Cathedral"What a blast Marching Powder is!! It felt like we were back in the mid 00's of British movies.With the likes of The Business, Dead Man Running, Football Factory & even Severance under his belt, Danny Dyer is back to his best and this is quite possibly his biggest and best role yet, with Danny (who plays Jack Jones) as the main focus.With Laugh out Loud British humour and many relatable one liners throughout, the cockney lad thrives once again on the football terraces but this time with a much more meaningful story which will resonate with so many of us as an audience.The runtime never once out stays its welcome, running at a pace that makes the movie extremely enjoyable.If you're a fan of British movies named earlier, then please go out of your way to catch 'Marching Powder' if for only the laughs.Trust me, you'll love it!

reviews.title: Marching Powder
reviews.content: The cockney actor spent ten successful years in EastEnders and has had hit and miss projects since then, this was the first feature length film he had starred in a long while. It was described as an "alternative" romcom, I knew roughly what to expect and I gave it a chance despite some mixed reviews, written and directed by Nick Love (The Football Factory, The Business, The Firm). Basically, Jack Jones (Danny Dyer) is a middle-aged bloke who has a heavy cocaine habit (the title is a euphemism) and is a violent football hooligan often getting into aggressive fights with other team supporters. Following his most recent arrest for possession of drugs, Jack is taken to court and warned by Judge (Philippe Brenninkmeyer) that he has six weeks to turn his life around. He must find steady employment and stay clean, or he will face a long spell in prison. So that they can keep a close ye on his progress, he is also to attend couples' therapy meetings with his long-suffering wife Dani (Stephanie Leonidas), previously an aspiring artist. Jack's reasonably well-off father-in-law Ron (Geoff Bell), who runs a scaffolding firm, also wants him to look after her brother, the unhinged and bipolar Kenny Boy (Calum MacNab), who has been released. All Jack wants to do is join his mates boozing in the pub and travelling to football matches, but he is trying to give up drinking, settling for pear juice. Jack makes an effort to reconnect with Dani, although she is unconvinced that he can change, and he spends more time with their eleven-year-old son JJ (Arty Dyer, Danny's real son). It is Ron holding him and Dani together financially, but he threatens and goads him often, hoping perhaps his failure will result in his daughter leaving him. There is an occasion when Jack surprises Dani with a romantic evening, and they have good sex, but things are bound to get in the way of their happiness. Jack finds employment in a Shoreditch coffee bar, but the attitudes of the customer anger him and he ends up getting into a scrape and losing this job. Eventually, Jack's old habits return when his friends, including Vinnie (Bailey Patrick), Jeff (Stanley J. Browne) and Roger (Dean Harrison) try to slip drugs into his soft drinks and convince him to join them at football matches, where they are certain to run into rival supporters. Jack goes all out and returns to snorting cocaine, and it appears he does not care if he gets in trouble. Meanwhile, Dani decides to try and go back to art college to fulfil her dream, and seemingly as an excuse to get away from Jack, even when he was trying to make things right. Whilst spending time with JJ, Jack becomes aware that Dani is at the college and is devastated that she may be cheating on him with her teacher. Jack decides to give up the drink and drugs again and try to get Dani back; he invites her to an Italian restaurant hoping she will show up. Dani initially rebukes him, and it looks like she may give into temptation and sleep with her teacher. However, in a Love Actually style moment, Dani appears outside the restaurant, and they write each other messages, him on napkins and her on her paper, before she walks in. They have a conversation, and Jack admits to treating her badly and not being a good husband, and she replies, "You're a C-bomb, but your MY C-bomb!" Six weeks have passed, the judge is satisfied that he has learnt from his bad decisions, having attended all his meetings with Dani and avoiding fights and drug use; Jack sees things on the mend in his life, but that does not mean he will be giving up football and it is likely he will still get into scraps. Also starring Lex Shrapnel as Vaughn, Janet Kumah as Gloria, Phillip Ray Tommy as Ziggy, Leon Dean as Fisher, and Daniel Fearn as Screw. Dyer breaking the fourth wall and playing the lairy geezer is likeable enough, Leonidas proves to be a tough cookie as his exasperated wife, Bell has his moments as the mean father-in-law, while McNab with his stupid bowl hairdo is chaotic and annoying. It is a rather simple story of a dude who must give up coke and booze to avoid trouble but fails miserably, the script has the occasional zingers and dark jokes, but it is overloaded with C-words that are incessant as opposed to funny, a below-average only just watchable comedy-drama. Okay!

reviews.title: Funny, not for people who are easily offended!
reviews.content: Lots of humour aimed at certain ideologies, drinking, and football culture from the 80s. Personally I found it really entertaining and was surprised as I wasn't expecting much. Lots of moments where I laughed in shock at was being said, and shaking my head in disbelief the next.Acting was ok, nothing Oscar worthy of course. Flow of the film stagnated slightly halfway through as I felt it repeated itself slightly. Apart from that I can't really find anything else bad to say. Typical quality of a British made film.Surprised it was aloud in cinemas in this age looking back. Will definitely watch again.

reviews.title: If you find Danny Dyer funny, you'll love this
reviews.content: I went to see this despite the poor reviews, not knowing what to expect, but having faith.I was not disappointed. It was entertaining throughout and in many moments I was laughing out loud. It's not one dimensional and actually does have a storyline, despite what others have said. It's about an aging male who only knows partying, drugs and violence trying and struggling to grow up.I think the sort of people who didn't like this must find Danny Dyers cockney london humour and style offensive and then it begs the question, why did they go to see it?Yes there is a lot of swearing, yes there is hooliganism violence and yes there is irresponsibility and lots of drug taking, all weaved together in the way only Danny dyer does. But that's what makes it great.Go see it, it's excellent!

reviews.title: A spellbinding masterpiece of storytelling!
reviews.content: I had the honor and absolute pleasure of seeing "Myth of Man" at a theatre in Los Angeles while it was on its North American premiere tour a few days back in December. How I came across this gorgeous art-piece of a movie is an interesting story. A teaser for the movie hit Facebook and Instagram back in September and I was instantly intrigued. Later in October the official trailer dropped along with premiere dates. I saw a sole Los Angeles date and something told me I just HAD to see it so I bought tix for me and the wifey as soon as I could.Up until then I was totally unaware of Director Jamin Winans' work. An Internet search led me to "Ink", which I saw to familiarize myself. I quickly threw myself into that movie which was made on only $250,000, and had flashes of greatness all throughout; greatness which comes into full fruition with "Myth of Man". After seeing "Ink", I was definitely intrigued.Before I talk about the movie, I must say that Jamin Winans and his wife Kiowa are absolutely two of the nicest, down to earth, personable and *real* people you are ever going to meet! We were the first ones to check into the movie theatre for the showing and they both came up and introduced themselves and recognized me from some of my Facebook comments on the movie's site. We chatted both before the rest of the moviegoers arrived and after the Q&A session and they seemed genuinely thrilled to show their work and connect with fans. I learned that the film took 3 months to shoot and over 3 years to finish post-production due to Jamin and Kiowa doing all of the 3500 VFX sequences the movie featured BY THEMSELVES! Not only that, they also sold their house and moved to a family farm in Kentucky where they converted an entire barn into a green-screen studio. Talk about dedication!About the movie...The husband-and-wife team drop the viewer into a wondrous alternate world that is so similar to our own and yet so very different. The world the movie takes place in has elements of 1920's - 1950's noir; with dollops of steampunk, magical realism and bits of Bioshock Infinite thrown in for good measure. It has its own styles of architecture (often gravity defying!), its own unique physics and its own religion and mythology. In many ways, the Winans' have made this world into its own character in the movie.The movie centers around 4 main characters. Ella (played by Austrian actress Laura Rauch) is a talented artist who is gentle, loving soul. An eternal optimist who sees magic and possibilities everywhere. Seeg (played by Anthony Nuccio) is described as an "art terrorist", an artistic soul with a gruff exterior. Boxback (played by fellow Austrian actor Martin Angerbauer) is a bully and a thug with the ability to amplify his voice as a weapon. Finally there is Caley (played by newcomer Ian Hinton) who is a pickpocket and thief with a heart of gold; and, incidentally, winds up stealing almost every scene he's in with his playful manner and infectious grin.Only a minor spoiler is that this is a "silent" movie. There *are* sounds, sound effects and music. However, there is no spoken dialogue in the movie at all. The reason for this is made known early in the movie: the main character Ella is deaf and mute, and the sounds (or lack thereof) are filtered through her and her perception of the world. Whereas it might be a big ask to expect the viewer to sit through a silent movie, simply know that this movie packs an enormous artistic and emotional punch without a single word needing to be said.The story centers on Ella's insistence that she has received a message from the divine...from her creator; and this is where the movie's title comes into play. There is a creation myth which the people of this alternate world believes in which heavily comes into play in Ella's motivations. The creator is believed to be represented by a divine comet that speeds through sky every day during this world's very brief night. The creation myth extolls that the creator's children can make contact with the divine by singing the correct song to it, and Ella spends most of the movie trying to collect enough songs of the people to attempt to make contact.This is, of course, an over-simplification of the plot but I don't want to spoil anything. What I will say is this.This is one of the best movies I have seen in a long, long while. There are so many details in the world the Winans' have created. You can easily lose yourself trying to figure out how things work in this world! The movie answers many questions, but leaves SO MANY MORE open for interpretation. The same goes with each of the main characters. You think you know each one at first blush, but wind up learning so much more as the story progresses.Anyone who is familiar with Jamin Winans' other works also knows the importance of music in his movies, and the same is true in "Myth of Man". Mr. Winans often composes the score to his movies as he's writing them; thus the music itself often becomes a movie character, making each scene more emotionally impactful.I'll be honest, I spent most of my time watching this movie with my mouth slightly open and in awe trying to take all the details in. There is so much to see, hear and feel in this movie and yet none of it is overwhelming. I was swept along the story and when it was over I hear myself audibly saying "Oh my god..!" at the end. This is a story about love, loss, religion (small r) and...most importantly...human connection. It's a movie you will want to see multiple times to see what you may have missed the last time.In short, Jamin and Kiowa Winans have created a masterpiece of a movie that reminds us of why we love to go to the movies. To sit in a darkened theater for a couple hours and be completely spellbound by a story and experience that will linger in your mind long after the end credits roll.

reviews.title: A Wonder
reviews.content: This film swims in the same waters as "City of Lost Children", "Brazil", and Chaplin's "The Kid." The visuals and invention are stunning - a world of brass fixtures, steam-powered dreams, and impossible architecture that defies gravity itself. The steampunk aesthetic extends beyond mere set dressing into the very fabric of the storytelling, where each mechanical marvel serves a narrative purpose. But it's the actors who really make this thing fly, bringing subtle humanity to even the most fantastical sequences. The lead performances in particular find that delicate balance between whimsy and emotional truth, grounding the film's flights of fancy in genuine human experience. Full of heart and creative to the nth degree, "Myth of Man" proves there's still room for films that take bold risks while remaining emotionally resonant. The director's vision never wavers, crafting a unique cinematic language that speaks to both the imagination and the soul. A rare gem - I'm excited to see how audiences receive this boldly original work.

reviews.title: Quite an experience
reviews.content: I was lucky to be able to get tickets to a premeire showing in TN, and loved this.It was quite an accomplishment for everyone involved, from acting to writing to Jamin's awesome score and Kiowa's great costuming. It was quite epic and I look forward to a wider release so I can see it again.Listening to Jamin and Kiowa describe the journey to gettiing this to the release point was also quite interesting (there was a Q&A after the show), and it shows the incredible dedication they have to their art. I was a fan of theirs from The Frame, which is one of my favorite movies, but honestly, this one is even better than I expected.I just hope they keep putting out this quality level, because we are better for it.Edit: I just wanted to add my admiration for the actors as well, they played thier characters so well, I knew exactly what they were saying, without saying a thing. See this when you get the chance, I'm sure you'll agree,

reviews.title: Beautiful, Unique Experience
reviews.content: The amount of creativity and effort that appears on screen is dazzling. Having been a big fan of the unorthodox storytelling and cool visuals of "Ink," I was very excited when I saw the trailer for this; however, I wasn't without reservations. Plenty of cool-looking films have turned out to be self-indulgent messes. I got a chance to attend a screening with some friends who were unaware of the Winans' other films and we were all blown away. While the film took a bit for me to become accustomed to its language, since it is entirely without dialogue/written word *and* is set within a sci-fi/fantasy world with its own rules, within 15 minutes I felt I was easily grasping most of what was occurring. Many elements of the world are presented without explanation, but the context clues lead me to so many a-ha moments that it feels like a lovingly-crafted puzzle. All aspects of design were very cool, in my opinion, as were the effects. The way the music/sound was integrated into the story worked well also. I was made to laugh and to cry at various moments, and I thought the ending was perfect. I can't wait to see it again, and I hope it is very successful. We could use more movies with such ambition and craftsmanship.

reviews.title: True Work Of Art !
reviews.content: I've Been Huge Fan Of 'Ink' & 'The Frame' And Now Comes This Lovely Gem From Masterminds : Jamin & Kiowa Winans , These Two Amazing Geniuses Truly Appreciate Cinema ! I Mean They Sold Their House Just To Be Able To Fund This Beautiful Movie !!! Wow I Don't Know How To Compensate Their Efforts And Last But Not Least, They Work On This True Work Of Art For Almost 3 Years Just To Complete The VFX Of The Movie ,Then They Moved To Their Family Farm And Turned A Barn Into The Green Screen Studio ! Thank You So Much Jamin & Kiowa For Your Creativity , Passion , Talent And Hardwork ,I've Been Waiting For Your Return. You Have My Highest Gratitude.

reviews.title: A visual tour de force and a must see!
reviews.content: I had the privilege to see this in London. I was absolutely blown away by it. It was beautiful, moving, funny, sad.. I ran the whole gamut of emotions. Brilliant! My normal sesquipedalian loquaciousness fails me as I fail to grasp the words to give this visual feast the description it deserves! However I shall do my best.Firstly, it's a dialogue free movie. It's not a silent movie,there's lots of sounds and music, some of it diegetic. The music itself should be billed as one of the stars as it does so much work. It's a major part of why this movie works so well.Of course the heavy lifting is done by the cast. Without dialogue you're relying on their facial expressions and movements to convey their inner thoughts. The lead heroine was fantastic. But the other main characters aren't just window dressing. They all bring a lot to the finished product.The story is... well, it defies description. To even attempt to would do it a grave disservice. It's a work of art that needs to be experienced for the viewer to make their own opinions. Interpretation of the movie isn't strongly defined. It's up to the viewers to make up their own minds about the narrative.It has got a real steampunk vibe..sorry "DieselPunk" as I was reliably informed by the director. At times I got both Jacques Tati and Gaiman/Burton vibes. At times it reminded me of Mirrormask but it's a creature born of a unique birth. It's unique and stands on its own two feet.If you like thought provoking, artistic, moving and creative movies you might like this. It's a breath of fresh air from the usual cookie cutter junk food action movies. It's slower but every second is a mouthful to savour.

reviews.title: An incredible piece of storytelling - compelling, beautiful
reviews.content: I'm going to have to make it clear from the start that I cannot do this film justice in my review. I am not skilled enough as a writer to be able to describe it and it deserves better words than I can throw together in my ham-fisted way, so what I'll try and do is explain why I like this movie so much and why and if that sounds like something that appeals to you then please go see it yourself.The reason it's so hard to describe is because the film makers have made their own world and that world is unfamiliar. It has a diesel punk aesthetic with ecchos of Fritz Lang's Metropolis or Dark City but it's not clear how it all works - there is no dialogue and it doesn't have exposition for the sake of understanding the film. What it has are characters - the people in the movie know what's going on and they are totally relatable.They have hopes, fears, they go on a journey. We see them navaigate their world, try to change it, try to change each other and it's magical and I have never been so engrossed in a story in my life at a cinema.We were lucky enough to have some time at the end for a Q&A with the film makers and lead actors and it felt like we could have been sat around a camp fire with them telling the story and they'd have begun as the light fades then we find ourselves cold, damp, the fire gone out and the sun rising at they finish theri tale but nobody would have noticed any of those things... the story is just so captivating.Will you like it? I don't know. I think people who are used to graphic novels will connect with it easier (I'm not a comic fan myself, but I appreciate how emotionally connecting an artform it is). Check out the trailer. Take a risk - it may be one of the most captivating films you ever see.

reviews.title: A loss for words
reviews.content: No matter how many words I pour out, I can't fully express my experience with Myth of Man. This truly spectacular film captivated me from the opening scene. Its dialog-free universe is a dazzling carnival for the senses, woven together by masterful music, immersive sound effects, and rich audio details. To truly appreciate its brilliance, see it on a large screen with a stellar sound system. I'm deeply grateful and genuinely thankful for this one-of-a-kind cinematic journey that left me in awe. I highly suggest seeing this movie on as big of a screen as possible as well as high quality speakers for the audio experience!

reviews.title: Someone actually made an interesting movie!
reviews.content: Well, I must say, Its been a while since I saw a movie worth watching.I honestly could not take my eyes off the screen for two hours!Visuals were spectacular! A mesmerizing Steampunk world with interesting characters and a captivating soundtrack.The visuals, story and the soundtrack draw out emotions and shows you the different sides of each character.Every detail of the story is a metaphor. Had My wife and I discussing the plot and details for hours! There is definitely A LOT left to personal interpretation.I am baffled at how little publicity this movie has received! All I can say is hats off to the writer and producer of this wonderful film.

reviews.title: For those who care...
reviews.content: It brings tears to your eyes to watch such a brave film in our times... This is a recipe that should be followed more... If not the only recipe to make a movie... It comes from people who care... So the question is: Do you want to watch more films like that? With a true heart beat of their own? Show and share your love and support. I'll try to do so...I 'm jealous of those who watched this stunning achievement in theatre... Congratulations to anyone involved... Magnificent film...I'm gonna watch Jamin and Kiowa Winans previous films as well right now... I'm sure some treasures are about to be found...

reviews.title: God + SteamPunk
reviews.content: A silent movie about the divine connection of music, the human soul & our creator. Who would have thought this could be done.. A movie about robotic cyborgs that has an anti-transhuman message..Again, Who would have thought that was possible.. This one had me wondering right until the end.. Yes, this world is a prison & when God calls us home its not a sentence, its a reward.. For those who have no clue about our connection to eternity & our eternal father, this movie will probably make little sense.. but for those who love scifi, steampunk but remain grounded in faith, this movie will keep on giving..

reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful film
reviews.content: We saw this film at a special screening in Nashville a few months ago at the Franklin Theater. This is a very mesmerizing piece of art and deserves to be seen!I just read a really negative review on here saying this is some sort of right-wing, anti-vax, pro-Christian, wet dream and wanted to respond -as one of the most pro-vax, non-religious, left-leaning people you'll ever meet. That review is complete nonsense!As with any art piece, there are about a million ways you can interpret anything. This movie isn't really political at all, at least not from a traditional ideology, and even if you DID want to put it in a political box, I'd say it is about non-conformity, rebellion, individuality, and acceptance - certainly not positions the US right believes in. Are there religious undertones? Maybe, if you are inclined to believe there are, you can find them. You can certainly find a "higher-power" but not a benevolent god one should worshipAt it's core, this is an incredible achievement in both aesthetic beauty and sound. It is a touching story of survival and friendship in a world gone mad. And it's all done with no dialogue. It's a two hour long sensory journey that you've never seen anything like before and may never see again. I would 100% recommend it.I really wish it had been released on more screens around the country because not seeing it on the big screen will most assuredly lessen the impact that it has on you. This is a work of art that deserves to be seen!

reviews.title: Sit back and enjoy the ride
reviews.content: I was drawn in by the music and atmosphere from the teaser trailer and when the full trailer came out, I was fully hooked. I was unable to see it in a theater, so I watched it online, and I was still blown away by it. This was one of the few movies I've seen where you just sit back and just experience it, like 2001 A Space Odyssey. The fact that there are no words, just adds to what's on the screen. I deal with PTSD, so the fact that this movie had nothing that triggered it was really appreciated. There are no jump scares or anything cheap along those lines. This is a movie for the ages. Watch it, and just sit back and enjoy the visual and aural ride.

reviews.title: Excellent film
reviews.content: Jamin Winans does it again with an artistic and emotional new film dealing with the connection between God and created beings. The movie is two hours long but the time flies. The score by the director was perfect, the actors were great even in the no spoken dialogue context of the film. There are a lot of meaningful tidbits to discover in the film which I will leave to the watcher. It is well worth viewing and one can only hope Jamin Winans puts more films out for the world to enjoy.I wont spoil the plot except to say the lead protagonist believes she received a message from her creator and the rest should be seen to be experienced.

reviews.title: Incredible
reviews.content: I would struggle to find the words to retell the story of Myth of Man but this is a film I will likely never forget. It is beautifully shot, the matt pastel colours are gorgeous and the music sublime. The lead actress is incredible - telling immensely moving chapters with just a furrow of her brow, a slight smile or a widening of her eyes - she is an incredible talent and I am sure she will go on to achieve marvelous things. The whole styling of this film pulls you in and keeps you amazed in scene after scene. I cannot recommend it highly enough and it's current score on IMDB of 5.5 is absolutely bewildering to me.

reviews.title: If you hate to think past the action heros' tagline and first shot, don't watch it. This is not your movie.
reviews.content: My take. It's about disability and the loneliness and isolation that it can bring. How those with the inability to hear, can still feel the weight of those screaming loudest to be noticed.It's also about the fear and stigma that it can bring.Then my ultimate take is that it's about those people sticking together as one and being heard just that much more, but having to learn to trust those you may not have ever trusted.It's an AMAZING movie. It's about pure emotional acting mixed with an even more amazing musical score.It is most definitely not a movie for those who don't think deeply about the meaning of what they are watching, past the action heros' tagline and/or heaving chesticles.It's art. Plain and simple. Interpret it how you wish.Perfect 10? Off course not. Nothing is perfect. But it's as close as it gets. Absolutely moving and brilliant!

reviews.title: Wonderful Film
reviews.content: Absolutely beautiful film that is wonderful to look at and moving to consider. I don't often watch films more then once, but I look forward to experiencing this film a second time. Thank you to the director, writer and cast that made this charming and deeply meaningful movie possible. As I was watching I could not stop myself from thinking about the amount of time and work that had to go into this project. With all the lazy writing and storytelling that is common with many films today, this was a breath of fresh air. The telling of a story through glances, facial expression and body language drew one to concentrate even more on the characters and their own idiosyncrasies. I found myself lost with them and rooting for them with each struggle they attempted to overcome. Really wonderful and moving experience.

reviews.title: Real magic
reviews.content: What a truly profound presentation of love and compassion. I wish more filmmakers would take the risks to create something so deeply moving as Myth of Man. There's something very special with each of Jamin.and Kiowa's films; each seems to take place in a world just outside our own, and in those worlds they create something timeless and magical, calling our attention to the human side of humanity. The bonds that connect us. Hope. Trust in there being more good than bad. Kindness. Empathy. The holistic human experience. And they do it like no one else. It's a perfect example of masterful storytelling, and Jamin is truly one of the finest composers in film, this proves it. Thank you for making this film, Jamin and Kiowa. Please never stop.

reviews.title: An underrated survival horror small gem masterpiece
reviews.content:
My Review:When i stumble upon the poster of this film, to be honest i thought that, this film is maybe one of those ridicilous cheap film. But oh i was wrong, its literally better than several of its higher budget counterpart. The music is good too and blend into the scene. For Indonesia and Malaysia cinema, which is its main primary target its 10/10. Definitely recommend it and well there are a lot of crocodile here, most of those bigger than Louisiana Alligator.The casting:Even though its not that awful, but the acting is kinda weak. It maybe understandable, its Aragao first film. (Joao Neves GF, Benfica players), there also Strates who is from South Africa. Muhammad Mansaray have the best acting skill among these newcomer.Horror AspectAt first those teenager are just regular high school student, some maybe spoiled by their parent but this time they must learn and fast. Alligator is hungry and they are not as dumb as they look, the show is using brute force to show the audience in the seats how terrifying those beasts are.Rate:
10/10.

reviews.title: Best Selling Films of 2025 in Malaysia already???
reviews.content: When the first teaser of this film came out in the "Pawagam", barely anyone who know this film, expect much. Most people don't know this film, It got dwarfed in marketing by film like Jurassic Park and Wolf Man who have much bigger budget. But The Bayou manage to defy the expectation, especially in this country.The Bayou managed to defeat Perayaan Mati Rasa and Lembayung. Despite Indonesian films have very prestigious status in Malaysia. Two biggest attribute of it's success are the casting and sound design/music. I can guarantee 100% that most low budget film like this better than those DEI Roided "w0k333" movie out there. Well sometime we need to get out of the comfort zone.The story is compact, the cast is fresh and music is just unique like the mish mash between some Malay Villager music with Navajo instrument.Still... Aragao and the other cast is still too green, so i give it 8/10.

reviews.title: Perfect suspense action thriller!
reviews.content: If you love a suspense thriller this is for you. If you love a creature horror - this is DEFINITELY for you. Just what Ive been waiting for. It's a great escape from reality and plenty of scares and jumps.I was also very impressed by the alligators! They were absolutely terrifying and made me never want to encounter one.Dont expect anything too 'serious'. It's a bit of fun in places - but thats just what the doctor ordered.I also love the implementation of humour in some parts, but also some emotion.I would definitely recommend this film if you want to have some jumps and scares and escape the real world for a bit.

reviews.title: What's not to like
reviews.content: What is not to like? A creature feature horror/suspense thriller puts you off rivers lol, some great jump scare moments in there and good characters all round. I thought the man who played Dom looks a very exciting upcoming actor and look forward to his future projects. The whole cast did very well. My only regret was I was unable to watch this movie in the cinema. I feel the big screen would really do this film more justice. I love a creature feature movie and was quite disappointed with the wolf man so I picked this next to try something different and was thoroughly impressed all in all of this is your sort of movie taste then your going to enjoy.

reviews.title: Don't waste your time or money
reviews.content: Terrible acting, horrible casting, and a storyline that feels like it was recycled from countless other films-but with an extra layer of awfulness. The dialogue is forced, the characters are unconvincing, and the pacing is sluggish. Any attempt at suspense or emotion falls completely flat. Even the cinematography and editing seem rushed and uninspired. It's almost impressive how every element of this movie manages to miss the mark. I think 1 star is overrating it-this is a complete waste of time.You will be surprised by the time you will waste watching this cheap movie. Can't believe I wasted my time.

reviews.title: ridiculous.
reviews.content: TW: there are spoilers.This is my opinion and my opinion only regarding this film. I do not have any prior knowledge regarding film making but you don't have to be a chef to critique. There was hardly any introduction towards the characters and how they related to each other. They just showed up at the airline suddenly. I feel that this movie could have showed us more meaningful scenes of the MC and her brother to show how much she truly cared. Or perhaps even how the friends were close to him since they followed the MC to spread his ashes. (also, at the end where the MC did manage to spread his ashes, the remaining friends did not even make it)The acting was weak and lack emotion. It really sounded and felt like the actors had just read the lines and said it out blatantly. The intensity and emotions were low. However, the actress who acted as Malika, did well as she was able to make that character stand out as a selfish and blame worthy person.The fear of planes for the MC wasn't even explained and was completely forgotten of as soon as they crashed. She suddenly evolved and became the leader. It seemed like they did not even have time to process what the hell had just happened.Also the portraying of how the chemical spread toward the water was barely captivating. It seemed like I was watching a music video with all the animations and colours.In the scene after they crashed and the co-pilot's body was just sitting up randomly seemed impossible as he looked hella unconscious.This movie seems to focus less on the crocodiles in terms of showing how fierce they are. The scenes seemed as if they did not have enough props to create more intensity.The crocs just come out of the blue and randomly which I get is because of the chemical, but it did not make sense when it was walking on some pipe or rail above Frank and took him down on one of the scenes.The horror/thriller aspect was not enough. The music in certain scenes did not match. However, in the beginning where the chomping began, the jumpscares were good, other than that it was just starting to get too predictable.All in all, i would rate the movie at a 1/5 stars as there were some satisfying scenes that needed to be applauded for. However, the movie just lacked the logic.

reviews.title: Exceeded expectations, had fun.
reviews.content: No spoilers.Based on some of the reviews on here my expectations were low. I chose to watch just out of curiosity; less mainstream horrors are generally what I go for when I want an easy win that doesn't require a whole lot of effort on my part.This fit the bill and actually exceeded my expectations. Fun plot that I don't think is so far fetched that it becomes a joke. Some nice SFX that I reckon on a bigger TV than mine would actually look the business. Cool music and general vibe to the whole thing, layered over the ever topical struggle between us and the natural world.Overall I think The Bayou was well worth it. It was entertaining, fun, actually pretty jumpy at times and so much more solid than what I was expecting.

reviews.title: What the literal...
reviews.content: Ug, talk about a bad high school project, whole thing was probably filmed from an iphone. The trailer says from the producers of "47 meters down" uh really?This is like cheap beyond cheap production, which is alright if they tried but the people are annoying, the story makes no sense, and just irritatingly the whole way that gives me a headache.Everyone in the film is so unlikable and makes no sense, was cheering for the CGI gators. I mean, yeah, these kinds of films should have annoying people, but there's a limit.And did the meth make the gather super smart too? That Jurassic Park 3 ending is ludicrous.Easily 1/10.

reviews.title: Skip
reviews.content: Writing this ias i'm watching in the theater. That's how boring this shvt is lolBad acting. Weak writing. Stupid cgiIt's cool for a cheesy movie night, not worth the money and time to watch in theaters.The girl who was getting on my nerves the whole movie was spitting the cringiest and dumbest lines ever. They want us to hate this character without even trying to!Spent 1:15 hrs and already feel like i wanna leave. Bottom line is, never expect this movie to be something, it's an empty sandwich.Too bad because i was excited to watch a scary movie about crocs but ended up with garbage low budget movie.

reviews.title: Review of The Bayou - A Disappointing Experience
reviews.content: Review of "The Bayou" - A Disappointing ExperienceIt's hard to understand the purpose of this film or the message it's trying to convey. For instance, how did the protagonist overcome her fear of flying? How were the relationships between the characters developed? And why was "Malika" portrayed as such an unpleasant character without any logical justification or character development? My criticism isn't about her personality itself, but rather the lack of any reasoning or evolution that explains her behavior.As for the alligator scenes, they were utterly disappointing, with weak CGI that is unacceptable for a film released in 2025. Honestly, Godzilla looked more realistic than these creatures! The alligators were supposed to be the core element of the film, yet their poor execution made them look like cheap animation, completely killing any sense of danger.The plane crashing just minutes after takeoff? That was completely unrealistic, feeling like nothing more than a lazy excuse to push the plot forward without respecting the audience's intelligence. As for the acting, there wasn't even enough material to judge in some cases-Kyle and her brother's flashback lasted mere seconds and added nothing of real value. Meanwhile, the performances of the main cast were flat and unconvincing.More importantly, the film failed to evoke any emotions-no tension, no fear, no excitement... just a series of empty events. And that final scene with Frank-what was the point? Just to show that he wasn't dead yet? It added absolutely nothing to the story.As for the alligators' aggression, there was no explanation whatsoever, making the film's central threat feel meaningless.Honestly, this film wasn't worth the time, the money, or the effort of going to the cinema.Advice to anyone considering watching it: Don't.

reviews.title: High Gator
reviews.content:
My title review already explain it.I'll try not to give any spoiler about the movie.When i watch the trailer, i feel that this movie looks promising.At first, u'll know why i use that as the title review. After that, the story goes along smoothly, the CGI looks good, the Sound effect and the jumpscares are ABSOLUTELY spot on (I love it).Though there's some unnecessary scene (like wtf are u doing there), stupid act, and also kind of little bit rushed in the end.Not bad for the casting, so overall its an average film.Kudos for the sound effect
So, if u wanna waste some time or money just to enjoy movie without thinking anything, this would be just enough.

reviews.title: Ignore the gator haters - The Bayou is undemanding fun.
reviews.content: After suffering through Skinamarink, one of the most boring horror films I have ever seen, I needed to cleanse my palate, so to speak. The Bayou fits the bill perfectly - it's a cheap and cheerful creature feature with absolutely no pretensions. It does exactly what it says on the tin and is actually better than I expected, with above average CGI for this kind of thing, a smattering of gore and reasonable performances.Athena Strates plays Kyle, who flies to the everglades with her friends to scatter the ashes of her older brother Jamie (Flynn Barnard). Disaster strikes when the plane experiences engine trouble and ditches in the middle of a swamp, where the alligator population has turned super-aggressive due to the powerful narcotic that was dumped in the water during a raid on an illegal drug factory.The film obviously won't win any awards for originality, but it's not trying to - it knows exactly what is required of it, moving swiftly along, delivering a few jump scares and a fair bit of suspense. And it doesn't scrimp on the gator action: there's numerous ravenous reptiles, both practical and computer generated, and they put quite a few similarly themed films to shame.6/10. Worth a go if it's a brainless, no-nonsense bit of fun you're after.

reviews.title: Jumped out of my seat
reviews.content: No spoilers!!!!!Make sure you put your popcorn down and definitely your drink if you don't want to ruin your sofa! Jumped out of my seat or more than one occasion! Won't be walking near our river any time soon if I can help it. Although I must admit not my usual genre, but reluctantly agreed to watch it with my husband and I wasn't disappointed, but don't tell him that, can't be watching this every night I need to be able to sleep without nightmares! I am sure the production team and lead actress will go onto great things. I am really looking forward to seeing what they do next and want to put my hands on that soundtrack!

reviews.title: This is probably better than it deserves
reviews.content: I have seen Rogue. This is not Rogue. This is of a lower quality, and some of the stock-footage of the actual animals is annoying. Some of the cgi used for the animals is decent, way better than one might expect from a movie like this, which is a lovely surprise.The characters are distinct and likable enough, and the actors do a good job of portraying them, giving them all enough life so that you can engage with them without overstaying or overstating them.This is not as tight as some other croc-related movies like Lake Placid or Crawl, but it is certainly better than Primeval or Black Water.This is enjoyable.

reviews.title: Much better than I expected.
reviews.content: I put this movie on last night not expecting much but it is so much better than I expected.I thought it would be on par with a lot of Asylum films but this is way better.The CGI is pretty good, the acting is also pretty good. Sure there's the expected a'hole characters and silly sacrifices but all in all it's a fun movie.What's not to like? People and alligators in the bayou.I don't know why other people have given it such rubbish reviews, glad I didn't read them before I watched it.I went in expecting rubbish and was pleasantly surprised.Why not give it a go.If you like creature features, this is the movie for you.

reviews.title: A fair enough alligator movie...
reviews.content: Truth be told, I am a sucker for killer animal movies, and thus I needed no persuasion to sit down and check out the 2025 movie "The Bayou".Writers Ashley Holberry and Gavin Cosmo Mehrtens put together a script that, while it was generic, was actually entertaining enough. It was a simplistic and straightforward script, and the writers didn't exactly bring anything new to the genre. Regardless, "The Bayou" proved to be an entertaining alligator movie.I was not familiar with a single actor or actress on the cast list, but I found the acting performances to be good. I actually do enjoy watching unfamiliar talents on the screen whenever I sit down to watch a movie, so that spoke well in favor of "The Bayou".The effects in the movie were good, which is a must for a movie with killer animals. There is nothing worse than sitting down and watching a movie where the animals look like they were discarded from a 1990s computer game because they looked to fake. Luckily that was not the case in "The Bayou".If you enjoy killer animal movies, then directors Taneli Mustonen and Brad Watson does deliver an enjoyable movie with the 2025 movie "The Bayou".My rating of "The Bayou" lands on a five out of ten stars.

reviews.title: Give it a crack, the aligator did
reviews.content: The release year ofThe Bayou (2025)states that it was 2025. Ok, but why on earth is such a movie like this produced in this day-and-age? With an estimated budget of $5 million (unconfirmed) I doubt that they saw a return out of this move.Madalena Arag√£o(Alice) reminded me ofKaya Scodelarioin her looks, I had to do some searching on that, as it happens, Kaya was in the movieCrawl (2019)which was about gators. Crawl was a better movie.Anyway, overall The Bayou was just ok, but below average for a 2025 movie.Athena Strates(Kyle) didn't quiet convince me that she was a gator expert.Elisha Applebaum(Malika) worked her magic and totally convinced me to dislike her character, so well done there, Elisha.Other actors trying to do their bit wereMohammed Mansaray(Sam) seemed to be confused whether he had to be the comedic relief or a wanna be hero. The crazed pilot, Frank (Andonis Anthony), was not convincing at being a leader.Tayla Kovacevic-Ebong(Dom) was probably the hero, or close to one.Overall, the effects were not too bad, the story and acting are what you would expect from the B movie. Would I recommend this? A few beers or wine and it is a yes.

reviews.title: Gator Creek: When the Monsters Aren't the Worst Part
reviews.content: Gator Creek tries to be a fun, tense survival horror, but man... it just doesn't work. The story is super predictable, the characters are beyond annoying, and the only real highlight is the gator attacks.The plot is exactly what you'd expect-a plane crashes in the middle of a Louisiana swamp, and the survivors have to deal with some nasty, mutated alligators. Sounds cool, right? Well, it would be if the movie didn't follow every horror clich√© in the book. You can see every "twist" coming a mile away, and there's way too much talking and arguing between attacks.The worst part? The characters. Kyle, the main girl, is already hard to root for, but Alice and Zoe? Easily two of the most annoying characters I've seen in a while. Alice is whiny and makes terrible decisions, and Zoe is just flat-out unbearable... mean for no reason and constantly making things worse. Every time they were on screen, I was just waiting for a gator to do us all a favor.That being said, the kills are actually pretty solid. The gators look decent, and when they do attack, it's brutal and fun to watch. There's a good mix of practical effects and CGI. The CGI isn't amazing, but it gets the job done. A couple of the deaths are actually pretty creative too, which was a nice surprise.Overall, Gator Creek is just kinda meh. It's got some cool kill scenes, but the slow pacing, predictable story, and annoying characters make it tough to sit through. If you just wanna watch gators wreck some people, it's fine... but if you're looking for a good creature feature, there are way better options out there.

reviews.title: The Bayou - doesn't deserve it's bad rating
reviews.content: The movie, at least in my opinion, is really underrated. It's really not that bad. With a better script, it's sequel could be a really good movie (if it gets greenlit). Alligators are kinda funky, not by the looks, they look great, but they're kinda unrealistic because of their behavior. No alligator (drugged or not) is THAT weird. I would watch this one, but don't expect too much. It's one of those movies that's good by being sorta bad. The characters make some pretty bad decisions, but it's understandable considering they're being chased by junkie alligators. Some characters are NOT likeable at all, but that's just life, you won't like everyone. Some outcomes are pretty predictable, and as far as the kills go, they are pretty creative.

reviews.title: Just what I was hoping for
reviews.content: This film delivers! I've watched a lot of gator films in my time- and this is one of the better ones.Characters are diverse and believable, storyline clear and consistent. reviews.title: Surprising, fun, scary, novel
reviews.content: Horror films are not a genre I would choose to watch but as an artist, I'm always curious. As a generation or so removed from them I'm especially interested in the work of young artists. My viewing experience of The Bayou was surprising, fun, scary and definitely out of my comfort zone (which is a good thing). The performances at times had a cinema v√©rit√© feel, maybe a reality show feel, which was interesting and anomalous. I stayed put for all the credits which educated me on what it takes to make a film of any length-huge commitment of time, money and more. Kudos to the entire production team for a novel movie viewing experience.

reviews.title: Laughable
reviews.content: Why would one film a movie that supposed to be set in the Southern US in Thailand???As someone who lives in the south this was very painful to watch. We have beautiful swamps and deltas that would be happy to have a movie filmed in them.Also I have to keep typing because it won't let me submit a review unless it's really long. reviews.title: Lack of fun
reviews.content: The opening river scenes look beautiful but are too short. Then comes the eye straining and unnecessary gun scenes.The characters are boring and the acting is unconvincing.The storytelling is meaningless and incoherent. The movie moves slowly and sluggishly.When they see the rude airplane pilot's ridiculous behavior, they still want to get on the plane. What a great idea.The scene where the crocodile first attacks seems contrived. It's not realistic. There have been better movies.The action in the hut is nice but insufficient.Passing through mutated sleeping crocodiles without making a sound is good courage, but it is exaggerated because I think they feel it.One of the most unnecessary characters survives to the end. For this reason, it is hard not to ask why. There are more realistic crocodile productions.

reviews.title: A decent popcorn horror held back by its characters
reviews.content: Let me start this review by saying that I am an absolute fan of survival horror, and I love movies where animals attack for some bonkers reason. So naturally, I was pretty excited to watch this. However, the ratings for this movie suggested it wouldn't be great, so I lowered my expectations before my viewing.The story follows a group of people who crash in a small plane in the wetlands of Florida, only to find themselves under attack from drugged-out alligators. The premise sounds hilarious and immediately reminded me of Cocaine Bear. However, this movie takes itself way too seriously, which harms the overall enjoyment, especially since it's not very competently made. The plane crash itself looked cheap and unconvincing, and the characters behave irrationally and stupidly. At times, it felt like a competition to see who could be the most unlikable, though one character was clearly way ahead of the others.The acting ranged from decent to a little poor, but I wasn't expecting much in that department. While the basic premise is fun, the movie doesn't do much with the idea. It had the potential to be much better, but weak characters, poor writing, and some subpar effects held it back. It definitely borrows elements from other films like Rogue, The Grey, the already mentioned Cocaine Bear, and even Jurassic Park III. Those are all movies I love, but this one fails to entertain in the same way.That being said, it's still a decent popcorn horror flick. If you don't overthink the logic or get too annoyed by the awful characters, you might have some fun with it. I overall enjoyed parts of it, and while the effects weren't great, they weren't Syfy-level bad either. The biggest downside is how unbearably stupid and annoying the characters are, making it really hard to root for most of them.If you're looking for a genuinely good horror movie featuring alligators or crocodiles, I'd recommend Rogue, which has a similar premise but executes it far better. However, if you're just in the mood for a fun action-horror flick with killer alligators, this might do the trick. [5,1/10]

reviews.title: As a horror movie this is better than the recent Wolf Man.
reviews.content: I love horror movies set in marshes, swamps, bogs, bayous n backwaters.Nothing beats the Louisiana swampland, a marshy wetland shrouded by fog-covered cypress trees, endless thicket of wetland trees, tangled overgrowth and its reptile population of gators and cottonmouth snakes.My favourites : Southern Comfort, Deliverance, Frankenfish, Venom, Hatchet, Fulci's The Beyond, Black Water part 1 n 2, Rituals 1977, Rogue, Eaten Alive 1976, Storm Warning, etc.Well this movie is set in a bayou n it's title itself is such but it failed to capture the creepines of the location.While some scenes are tension filled n the crocs are terrifying, some scenes are pure lol.I don't kno how the guy survived in the end. His head is almost swallowed by the croc, the croc falls down with the man's body from a big height n he gets only few scratches on the neck.

reviews.title: An appropriately cheesy and enjoyable creature feature
reviews.content: Taking a scenic trip together, a group of friends take a plane trip through a local swamp to scatter a dead friend's ashes, but when an accident strands them in the swamp they find themselves stalked and killed by ravenous alligators protecting their territory from intruders and must band together to survive.Overall, this was a solid and entertaining creature feature. Among the better elements of this one is the generally cheesy and overall intriguing means that it goes about getting the setup for not just the ravenous gator attacks but also the group of victims out to the swamp. The initial idea of the gators getting poisoned with a special drug supply that's shown getting dumped into the river by a drug lord during a federal raid on the compound serves as a way to explain the extra aggression and unnatural activity exhibited here, which is quite fun to see play out. Likewise, the idea of the trip being undertaken to honor a friends' memory who had just recently died in an accident that was inadvertently their fault is enough of a reason to get them out into the middle of nowhere, especially with the sketchy behavior shown that they ignore to take the trip in the first place. That makes for a strong base to string the series of extended but no less intriguing attacks off of. The incidental crash and emergency landing in the swamp, which is then further impeded by the creatures trying to break into the wreckage to get at the last ones out of the plane, gives this a fine starting attack scene with the compounding chaos creating a lot to like. The first few encounters on land, taking out stragglers on the outskirts of the group or just emerging out of nowhere to snap at them, help out rather nicely, and the larger scenes have a lot to like. From the creatures chasing the group out of the woods to a flimsy shack for protection or an escape attack on a raft that gets ambushed and the slow-motion trek past the sleeping creatures, it manages to pull off a series of decent enough scenes that aren't entirely original but are serviceable enough, especially with the practical effects and gore over the CGI creations used elsewhere. These provide the film with enough to be enjoyable, while there are some issues with this one that hold it back. The biggest drawback with this one is the rather stifled pacing that makes everything feel quite sluggish and slow-going despite the quick running time. Focusing on the slew of issues it does with the main group who are going through the problems that they are, most of these make the group feel even more unlikable than they already are, which isn't a good look to things. With fidelity concerns in a relationship, past examples of cowardice being used to psychologically unravel people into activities that will compromise their safety unnecessarily, or featuring a twist ending that puts their behavior straight out of another movie entirely simply to have a surprising outcome featured, the group here is really hard to get behind and the film does little to make them any better the longer it goes on. Combined with the usual assortment of bad decision-making found in this particular genre and some generally underwhelming CGI for the crocodiles, this one does have some flaws to it.Rated Unrated/R: Graphic Violence and Graphic Language.

reviews.title: Medieval Marvel
reviews.content: What's so fun about this movie is that it takes you places that has some comfort and familiarity, but then it keeps you guessing at other moments. You can't look away!The visuals are REALLY good, the micro-instances of humour land well and are welcome relief from the intense moments, giving you a breath before jumping back into the action. The sword fights are impressive and there's a real heft to them, which can't be said for all movies of this style.The performances of the cast and music throughout really bring you into the world and keep you there! I'd happily welcome a part 2 to this story if it ever inspired the creators to do so.

reviews.title: I learned a lot about witches
reviews.content: The plot twists were unexpected and had me guessing where the next scene would be going. The costumes, makeup, acting and special effects smoothly transported me into the fantasy realms of the story.I must say, I learned a lot about witches! The ladies were captivating and alluring in their roles as powerful witches that teased and toyed with the protagonists Bhodie and Avalon.I highly recommend this movie to anyone looking for a well made Canadian horror/fantasy with surprisingly well placed comedic moments that catch you off guard.Well done to all the actors and crew. Looking forward to the sequel.

reviews.title: Great!
reviews.content: From start to finish - the action doesn't stop. The gore is great and the story line rolls well. The craziest part - I've heard it was shot in the directors backyard. There is nothing like independent films being made the way they used to be.Without directors/writers and actors like Matthew, the movie independent movie industry would fall short. It's his renegade style and confidence to pull off such a movie that is rather impressive.Please, give the movie a go, I'm sure you will be as impressed as I was with the style in which the movie was shot.Be warned, it's not for kids. The gore and storyline are well passed the age of those under 18.Enjoy!

reviews.title: Bringing Good Cinema back.
reviews.content: I'm a stickler for adventure films that go on epic journeys, especially ones to a fantastical hellish realm, throw in the (spoiler alert) endless death loops, terrifying witches, and devilish monsters and you have an incredible medieval horror film with an even more intriguing plot. It's Bhodie's inner struggle of worth and belonging and Avalons insatiable quest for revenge that makes them a dynamic duo. And there's even a plot twist! A Knights War has so much to offer, from the epic costumes, effects, gore and insane set design (iykyk). It's a visceral reinvention of genre and damn good storytelling.

reviews.title: Haven't seen a good fantasy movie like this in a long time
reviews.content: I had completely given up on fantasy movies because I found that they are generally low-budget tripe, often resembling film school projects. Even those with larger budgets tend to suffer from a lack of good storytelling and originality.This movie was an absolute shock to me. It took a few minutes to adjust to its style, but it was beautifully shot, and the effects were tastefully executed, giving the film a higher-budget feel than it likely had.The plot and story were great-very original and engaging. While the dialogue felt a bit wooden in a few places, it was actually quite strong overall.I thoroughly enjoyed this movie.As an aside, many of the actors have worked together on other movies and two of the actors who play brothers in the movie are likely brothers in real life as they have the same last name. Their profile doesn't say that though at the moment.

reviews.title: ya
reviews.content:
Gotta be kidding me...fake review after fake review after fake review...and PROBably from the same person using different 'imdbfan' accounts...
definitely one of THE major drawbacks of this website...and, when one thinks about it, there's really nothing they can do...what are they going to do, check the background on each and every review? It's hard enough, i'm sure, to just check the REAL reviews...
anyways...this seems like it was written by a teenager and done on an extremely, shoestring, miniscule budget. Bad acting...bad directing...and bad reviewing. And those are the GOOD things about it.

reviews.title: A Knights Bore
reviews.content: And now for the real reviews. Can't think of one good thing to say about this medieval wooden bucket of crap. Poor acting,poor effects,poor script,poor movie,poor poor poor.It baffles me how these movies get made. Surely someone involved in the making of it would eventually say "guys this is just terrible,can we stop now". Unless it's your aim to actually make a bad movie as a revenge thing on one of the actors or investors.I'm struggling to make the 600 letter review because all I can say is its crap. Hahahaha.It's a big shame though because money and time has been spent badly and I'm a huge fan of medieval,knights type movies so foolishly watched it all.

reviews.title: A Genuine tale of Sword and dark Sorcery.
reviews.content: This Is Not a Fake Review. Check out my other reviews by clicking on my username to prove it. Thx!Going into A Knight's War I was expecting a poorly told and poorly produced B Movie. Strangely that's not at all what A Knight's War is. Surprisingly it's really a pretty well made and well told fantasy adventure story.The Knight takes on an oath to save an innocent woman and fulfill a prophecy and from there an adventure to the depths of darkness unfolds.The film is genuinely well made. Is it perfect? Certainly not, and some small failures of editing make the story difficult to follow at first. But if you stick with it all makes sense as the story progresses.The scenes are convincing and the atmosphere is gritty and dark. This film constantly reminded me of the Dark Souls and Mortal Shell video games, which is definitely a compliment to it's art direction and Visual Effects.The script is competently written medieval fantasy and the actors portray their heroic characters with depth and gravitas. I was particularly impressed by the portrayal of a genuinely good and noble knight fighting against the forces of darkness in both his inner and outer world. And the female protagonist is convincing as a woman torn apart by the lust for revenge.This film is a genuine dark fantasy sword and sorcery and it's depiction of medieval knights and dark magic is impressive. Most of all it's a solid and exciting action adventure movie and a genuine effort to do the genre justice.Is it a bit rough around the edges? Sure, but it's merits shine through and make it an enjoyable watch with a satisfying story arc.A bit sad and unfair that the positive reviews of this film are being down voted just because it is a B Movie. Because actually, it totally deserves the positive reviews it's getting.If you like films like Solomon Kane, or Excalibur, then check out A Knights War. Give it a chance, it's a good watch! :D.

reviews.title: Similar Vein To Solomon Kane But A Lower Budget
reviews.content: I really love these old school type fantasy / action films with good vs evil etc.The only thing that's lets it down is the budget, some special effects seem cheap but everything else is solid, the acting, action and story.I don't really understand the bad reviews, they clearly went to some effort to make a solid film here, which in my opinion doesn't fall on deaf ears.Similar vein to the film Solomon Kane, and if you haven't seen that one then I highly recommend it also.Give it a shot, not bad at all, not going to give away any story elements here but it also reminded me of computer games like The Witcher or something.Knights verses witches and demons, what's not to love?

reviews.title: Excellent Fantasy Watch
reviews.content: A Knights War movie is really fun, and has a souls-like quality to it, a nice cherry on top for the people that enjoy video games and dark fantasy.I personally enjoyed this particular film since it brings me back to the off-shoot sword and sorcery movies (the really edgy ones that are few and far between!) such as Solomon Kain and the like.This type of film is refreshing and we need more of it in my opinion, I'm kind of sick of seeing Pedro Pascal and Chris Pratt, and Florence Puth as every male/female lead. (No offense, love them but. . . Come on, there's other awesome actors out there)All of the actors in this film were fantastic, both leads, and the demon, the witches were superbly designed and the overall aesthetic/mood of the film really does express skillful creativity on a budget. Well executed film!

reviews.title: High Quality Dark Fantasy Indie Film
reviews.content: I watched the film at the Toronto Revue Cinema premier. Post film, I stayed for the live Q&A and learned that the sets were hand built in the directors backyard which was fascinating, including the minimal resources he had to work with.This movie looks and feels like something made with tens of millions, yet is pulled off with less than the craft services budget of large films. I'm a big fan of the art direction, sets and costumes feel inspired by the video game series Dark Souls. The story left me wanting more of this dark fantasy. Imagine want this director could achieve if given a real budget. I hope we're witnessing a new Neill Blomkamp in the making.

reviews.title: loved itt!!!
reviews.content: Dude, this movie was thrown together on a dime, and it's still fire-way better than those bloated big-budget disasters. You know how it goes: Hollywood dumps millions on CGI and overhyped stars, and it's still a snooze or a total mess. This flick? No cash, no problem. They leaned on guts, good writing, and some real-deal effort. It's crazy how they made it work with peanuts while the fat-cat films tank hard. That scrappy, underdog energy hits different-proof you don't need deep pockets to make something worth watching. Just some heart and hustle. Big-budget clowns could learn a thing or two from this.

reviews.title: Ambitious Fantasy Film that needed some early narrative editing
reviews.content: This film is ambitious, it's atmospheric, moody and serious. The costumes are beautiful, the sets and locations are too. The cinematography, score and CGI helps with building this world, and the actors were great.The flaws: this film needed some early critical editing to the story. There was potential for a unique fantasy world to emerge, but I think what we saw was a patch job of various narrative tropes mixed together.I think clarity, directness, and the courage to propose/build one's own fantastical world would have had a more weighty creative impact on the viewer and it would have helped immerse oneself into someone else's imagination.I do not want to discourage anyone from seeing this movie! It is incredibly impressive what can be done by motivated creatives, and it's still very fun. Give it a shot if you have the opportunity!

reviews.title: Not great not terrible
reviews.content: I love this type of movie,so I'm possibly it's target audience...I simply cannot agree with the 1 star reviews,they seem hostile for the sake of being hostile. Its not up there with the likes of Excalibur,but like another review suggested,more like a slightly lower budget Solomon Kane. Wish there was more action,but the story flows pretty well, decent special effects for the low budget. Acting was solid nothing oscar worthy but it gets the job done...Now,makes me want an actual sequel or reboot to Solomon Kane....and again those 1 star reviews are beyond ridiculous,it's nowhere near that bad, straight in the bin with them.

reviews.title: Another Vikram special with a flawed story narration
reviews.content: "Veera Dheera Sooran Part 2" is a film that impresses with its visual grandeur and Vikram's captivating performance, but ultimately falls short due to a messy and disjointed storyline. While the film delivers moments of cinematic brilliance, its narrative inconsistencies and lack of proper flow prevent it from being a truly satisfying experience.Vikram shines as the lead, delivering an amazing performance that showcases his versatility and commanding screen presence. His portrayal of the character is both powerful and captivating, elevating the film's overall impact.The cinematography is a major highlight, with stunning visuals that capture the film's epic scale and scope. The film's musical score is equally impressive, adding to the atmosphere and enhancing the emotional moments.However, the film's narrative struggles to maintain a cohesive flow. The plot feels convoluted and lacks a clear sense of direction, making it difficult to fully engage with the story or connect with the characters. The pacing is uneven, with some scenes feeling rushed while others drag on unnecessarily.Despite its flaws, "Veera Dheera Sooran Part 2" is a watchable film, primarily due to Vikram's stellar performance and its impressive visual and musical elements. However, its messy and disjointed storyline prevents it from being a truly memorable or impactful cinematic experience.

reviews.title: HOLY MOTHER OF-VINTAGE VIKRAM JUST NUKED TAMIL CINEMA!
reviews.content: "Seriously, S. U. Arun Kumar? You just unleashed vintage, high-voltage Vikram on us! Pure OG Chiyaan vibes. From the "Sethu"-inspired title font to the "Dhool" song, this movie delivers as a Chiyaan show. And that unpredictable interval block? Mad Respect!Now, let's be clear: if you're expecting "Dhool 2.0" or the emotional depth of "Chithha", you're looking in the wrong place. This is a wild, crazy ride, and Vikram as Kaali? He's an absolute beast.Picture this: a normal dude, just running his shop, gets sucked into this crazy criminal mess during the village festival. And his old boss, Ravi, played by Prudhvi, is reuesting him to save his son, Kanna, from this cop, Arunagiri (SJ Suryah), who's out for blood. Turns out, this cop wants to take them down hard, like, "encounter" level, because they totally humiliated him and his dad before. So, the whole movie is just this one wild night, seeing how it all goes downIf you crave that conventional mass entertainer, you'll eat this up. The entire cast crushes it, but SJ Suryah as the cop? Man, he's next level. And Suraj Venjaramoodu? Creepily brilliant.And the camera work? Brownie points for the single shot will be remembered as one the best sequence in the film.GV Prakash's music? Straight fire. It amps up the mass scenes, and there's a throwback to Vikram's "Madhura Veeran," and the crowd went wild. Theatre was shaking, for real. Now I'm hyped for what he does with Ajith's "Good Bad Ugly."In closing, "Veera Dheera Sooran: Part 2" is a banger. It has a few rough edges and loses momentum in places, but that doesn't diminish the overall movie experience. Just go in with the right expectations, ready for a wild ride, and you won't be disappointed to see Chiyaan back in a full-blown mass role. I'm already waiting for the prequel!

reviews.title: A comeback for Vikram, A Directorial Masterclass.
reviews.content: Gripping and engaging storyline from the start till the end. GV Music, hats off to him, Director did his job well. Everyones acting was phenomenal, Vintage Vikram is back. A few lags but they aren't affecting the screenplay as much as its racy. Overall a wonderful watch. Do go to theatres and have a blast.The director chose to release second part first, and first part will definitely be coming out after this masterclass. The BGM carried and the long single shot was so impressive and well-made. The action of the movie was set up well, and the set pieces were incredible. Another blockbuster for Kollywood.

reviews.title: High emotions and gripping thriller!!
reviews.content: VIKRAM IS BACK WITH A BANGER!! S. U ARUN KUMAR HAS DELIVERED ONCE AGAIN! WAS WORTH THE WAIT! BEST MOVIE OF 2025 IN TAMIL SO FAR!ALL THE ACTORS DID GREAT!! GV PRAKASH PEAKED WITH HIS BGM AND MUSIC!OVERALL A GREAT TREAT FOR THE AUDIENCE AND A MUST WATCH MOVIE FOR EVERYONE!!!The story and the way emotions were carried out was impeccable and the way the whole movie came together was very intense and gripping!!Can't wait to see how everyone receives the movie, should be a blockbuster in terms of how I felt about the movie. Let's wait and see how it does!Hope everyone gets to watch in the big screen and enjoy the magic!

reviews.content: Excellent first half followed by poor second half. Performance/Acting was good by everyone (infact overacting in many scenes) the initial 10-15 mins screenplay was excellent and triggered our curiosity on what will happen next. Infact tempo was good till first half. Somewhere things lost in second half (either poor writing or screenplay, or director not sure how to end this) so many dragging and unnecessary scenes filled in second half. After the excellent elevation for hero director couldn't keep up the expectations. Forget logic completely (in one scene hero is in another location and another scene he's in completely different location). Definitely editor should've done much better work. As usual chiyaan gave his best for this movie but poor writing and logic less scenes let down the second half. Clearly we see the confusion from director if this movie should be portrayed as pure mass movie or it should be close to reality. Cinematography and music was good. One time watch. Could've been better (but definitely better than Chiyaan's recent past movies).
