Search for the behind-the-scenes videos.People who insult the director and crew and give the movie a very low rating do not respect the 10,000 people, many of whom gave their best years to this project.

reviews.title: definitely worth watching!
reviews.content: Creation of the Gods 2 delivers a visually stunning and ambitious continuation of its epic saga, blending ancient Chinese mythology with modern cinematic flair. For fans of grand storytelling and immersive world-building, this sequel offers a compelling mix of action, drama, and artistry that makes it a standout in the fantasy genre.What Works:Breathtaking Visuals: The film's production design and CGI are a feast for the eyes. From towering celestial palaces to intricately choreographed battle sequences, every frame feels meticulously crafted. The mythical creatures and godly realms are rendered with vivid detail, making it a must-watch on the big screen.Expansive Storytelling: The narrative dives deeper into the conflicts between mortals, immortals, and demons, weaving together themes of power, loyalty, and destiny. While familiarity with the first film helps, the sequel does enough to engage newcomers with its dramatic tension and character dynamics.Strong Performances: The cast, led by seasoned actors and rising stars, brings emotional weight to their roles. Standout moments include nuanced portrayals of moral dilemmas and alliances, adding depth to the larger-than-life plot.Pacing and Scale: The film tightens its pacing, balancing quieter character moments with adrenaline-fueled set pieces. The final act, in particular, builds to a crescendo that leaves audiences eager for the trilogy's conclusion.Not as good as the first one, but definitely worth watching!

reviews.title: A Spectacular Sequel That Elevates the Epic
reviews.content: "Creation of the Gods II: Demon Force" is nothing short of a cinematic masterpiece that seamlessly blends fantasy, action, and rich cultural elements into a breathtaking spectacle. As a sequel, it expands on the world introduced in its predecessor, delivering a storyline that is both grand in scale and deeply personal in its emotional resonance.The film's strength lies in its impeccable visual effects. The mythical creatures, grand battles, and magical elements are brought to life in a way that is both awe-inspiring and immersive. The CGI is top-notch, setting a new standard for the genre. Every frame is meticulously crafted, with vibrant colors and meticulously detailed action sequences that draw you deeper into its fantastical world. The battles are brutal yet beautiful, with each clash feeling like a carefully choreographed dance of destruction.The plot continues the journey of gods, demons, and mortals, exploring the delicate balance between good and evil. The storyline is rich and layered, with new characters introduced who are compelling and well-developed. What truly makes "Demon Force" stand out is its emotional depth. Despite the larger-than-life battles and supernatural occurrences, the film never loses sight of its characters' personal struggles. The themes of sacrifice, loyalty, and the consequences of power are explored in poignant and thought-provoking ways.The performances are outstanding across the board. The cast has excellent chemistry, with each actor fully embodying their respective roles. The protagonist's journey is particularly moving, as they face moral dilemmas and the weight of their actions. The supporting characters are not just sidekicks; they have depth and provide crucial moments of insight and emotional connection to the larger narrative.The pacing of the film is well-balanced, ensuring that the action doesn't overpower the heart of the story. There is a sense of urgency and tension throughout, but also quiet, reflective moments that ground the fantasy in human emotion. Director's vision is clear, crafting a movie that appeals to both fans of high fantasy and those looking for a story with emotional depth.In conclusion, "Creation of the Gods II: Demon Force" is a triumph in every aspect. From its stunning visuals to its emotionally charged performances and gripping storyline, this film is a must-see for anyone who appreciates epic cinema. It sets a new benchmark for films in the fantasy genre, and I wholeheartedly recommend it. A perfect 10 out of 10!

reviews.title: Creation of the Gods: Demon Force
reviews.content: With the all-conquering "Shang" dynasty looking as if it's about to die out, their ailing King commands his young general "Deng" (Nashi) to attack the fortified city of Xiqi and retrieve something that might just prevent their extinction. Meantime, the folks in that city are ruled by a young man "Ji Fa" (Yosh Yu) who is enthusiastic and honourable, but not exactly a tactician. Despite his best efforts, the encroaching army arrives at the walls of his city aided by four powerful giants, all equipped with magical talisman. It's during this battle that the lines are truly drawn with a few immortals coming to the aid of the city and with both "Ji" and "Deng" finding themselves facing a new scenario for which neither are prepared, and which tests their mettle and their loyalties as an angry denouement looms. This is my kind of film: mixing mystery and mythology with superb special effects and a solid story that, though maybe a little predictable towards the end, has all the ingredients of a stylish and engaging acton-adventure. There's imagination a-plenty gone into the production and the characterisations offer us a little more than just the usual linearly flat persona. The green flying ogre works hard for his living here, and the last twenty minutes are lively and colourfully delivered. Might their be a trilogy? It does need a cinema, a big screen makes all the the difference.

reviews.title: IMDb Stars Unmasked
reviews.content: If Badass Ravikumar was any more over-the-top, it would be impossible to watch without laughing. Himesh Reshammiya leads this absurd spectacle with a performance that defies logic-his character is impossibly strong, constantly delivering lines that are so cheesy, they're a blast to repeat. The action scenes are a mashup of impossible stunts and excessive slow-motion, creating a cinematic experience that's all about thrill and spectacle. The soundtrack is classic Himesh, full of fast-paced tracks that will have you tapping your feet. The dialogues? Pure masala gold-dramatic, exaggerated, and totally fitting for the film's tone. The plot might not make a whole lot of sense, but Badass Ravikumar doesn't care-it's all about providing a wild ride of pure, unfiltered fun. So, leave logic at the door and enjoy this crazy rollercoaster of a film.

reviews.title: This movie is totally worth it
reviews.content: Badass Ravikumar is a cinematic tornado of insanity that you just can't look away from. From the moment it starts, it's clear that this film knows exactly what it is-a high-octane, over-the-top celebration of everything that makes masala cinema so entertaining. Himesh Reshammiya fully commits to his role, giving a performance that's larger-than-life, blending cheesy one-liners with a level of seriousness that somehow makes it all the more absurd. The action is an exaggerated mix of every action-packed Bollywood trope imaginable, where the laws of physics don't apply, but the fun factor is off the charts. The music, characteristic of Himesh, is irresistibly catchy, with beats that are bound to keep you grooving long after the credits roll. The dialogues are dripping with melodrama, creating an aura of nostalgia for fans of 80s Bollywood masala. While the plot may be thin and riddled with plot holes, Badass Ravikumar doesn't need to be anything more than a riotous ride that leaves you laughing and shouting "this is cinema at its most unapologetic!" If you're looking for logic, go elsewhere. But if you're craving mindless fun, buckle up, because Badass Ravikumar delivers chaos like never before.

reviews.title: Madness and Masada overloaded
reviews.content: From the very first scene, Badass Ravikumar sets the tone for a cinematic experience that is pure, unfiltered madness. The film doesn't bother with subtlety-it dives headfirst into the world of outrageous action, larger-than-life performances, and a plot that takes a backseat to the thrills. Himesh Reshammiya delivers a performance that feels like a celebration of everything over-the-top about Bollywood cinema. He embraces the absurdity of the character with open arms, throwing himself into every scene with such commitment that you can't help but be drawn into his chaotic world. The action sequences are the stuff of legends-if legends were completely absurd and utterly ridiculous. But that's what makes them so entertaining. The music, of course, is catchy as ever, with beats that have you moving even as the film spins further into the realm of absurdity. The dialogues are filled with so many one-liners and dramatic monologues that it's impossible not to laugh at their sheer ridiculousness. While the storyline is predictable and the depth non-existent, Badass Ravikumar doesn't try to be anything it's not. It's just pure, unapologetic fun from start to finish, and that's exactly what you sign up for when you watch it.

reviews.title: Very poor
reviews.content: Badass is a film that utterly fails to impress, falling short in almost every aspect. The graphics and visual effects are embarrassingly outdated, resembling something from a low-budget production rather than a modern action movie. In fact, playing a 90s video game would likely provide a more immersive and visually appealing experience. While the story has some potential, it is ultimately wasted due to an incredibly weak screenplay that lacks depth, coherence, and engaging dialogue.The action sequences, which should have been the movie's strong point, are completely absurd and devoid of any logic. Instead of thrilling, high-stakes moments, viewers are subjected to poorly choreographed fights and unrealistic stunts that make the film feel like an unintentional parody. Every so-called intense moment is ruined by laughable execution, making it impossible to take anything seriously. The movie consistently sacrifices believability for over-the-top, nonsensical action, which only makes it more frustrating to watch.Despite a somewhat decent premise, Badass ultimately fails due to its weak direction, poor pacing, and lack of compelling characters. The performances feel uninspired, with actors delivering lines in a way that lacks emotion or impact. Even the most action-hungry audiences will struggle to find anything worthwhile here. Instead of being an enjoyable, adrenaline-fueled ride, the film is nothing more than a collection of poorly put-together scenes that fail to create any real excitement.In the end, Badass is a massive disappointment. It is an example of how bad filmmaking can completely ruin a potentially good concept. With its terrible visuals, illogical action, and a painfully bad screenplay, it feels like a complete waste of time. Even die-hard action fans would be better off skipping this one.

reviews.title: Watch Rajkumar Rao exciting acting
reviews.content: Badass Ravikumar is the kind of film that will leave you with a smile on your face from start to finish. It's a non-stop, high-octane ride full of ridiculously fun action, campy performances, and a sense of humor that doesn't take itself seriously for even a second. Himesh Reshammiya is having the time of his life as the titular character, throwing himself into the role with such enthusiasm that it's contagious. The action is outlandish, the stunts are laughably unbelievable, and the soundtrack is filled with songs you'll find yourself singing along to. The movie has no interest in being taken seriously, and that's exactly why it's so much fun. If you're looking for a movie that knows how to celebrate its own ridiculousness, Badass Ravikumar is the one to watch.

reviews.title: Performance is Outstanding
reviews.content: Badass Ravikumar is a cinematic rollercoaster that takes everything we know about action, drama, and masala films, and cranks it up to eleven. Himesh Reshammiya delivers a performance so larger-than-life that it could only belong in this kind of unhinged film. He's simultaneously a hero, a comedic character, and an over-the-top action star, all wrapped into one. The film's action scenes are a ridiculous spectacle, combining nostalgic Bollywood tropes with a modern flair that borders on the absurd. You'll be laughing, cheering, and cringing all at once, but that's what makes the film so addictive. The soundtrack, naturally, is packed with energetic tracks that perfectly complement the action on-screen. The dialogues are classic masala-full of dramatic, unforgettable one-liners that add to the film's over-the-top charm. The plot doesn't matter much here-it's all about the experience. If you're after a film that celebrates chaos and excess in the best way possible, Badass Ravikumar is a crazy, entertaining ride you won't soon forget.

reviews.title: Beyond the IMDb Score
reviews.content: Badass Ravikumar is exactly what the title promises-an unapologetically over-the-top, masala-filled rollercoaster that thrives on sheer absurdity and entertainment. Himesh Reshammiya fully embraces the madness, delivering a performance that is both unintentionally hilarious and deliberately exaggerated, making it impossible to look away. The action sequences feel like a fusion of 80s Bollywood nostalgia and internet meme culture, creating moments that are bizarre yet incredibly fun. The music, as expected from Himesh, is packed with infectious beats that stay with you long after the film ends. The dialogues are outrageously dramatic, filled with one-liners that add to the film's campy charm. While the storyline itself isn't groundbreaking, the film never pretends to be something it's not-it thrives in its self-awareness, leaning into every bit of its chaotic energy. If you're looking for logic or deep storytelling, this isn't the film for you. But if you want an over-the-top spectacle that celebrates its own ridiculousness, Badass Ravikumar is a wild, fun-filled ride that delivers exactly what it promises.

reviews.title: I really enjoyed the film.
reviews.content: There are movies. There are experiences. And then there's Badass Ravikumar, which exists in a category of its own. This isn't just a film; it's a love letter to over-the-top Bollywood excess, drenched in melodrama, packed with punchlines, and unapologetically outrageous from start to finish. Himesh Reshammiya plays the titular role with a commitment so intense, you'd think he's leading an epic saga of Shakespearean proportions-except it's a non-stop barrage of slow-motion walks, larger-than-life action, and dialogues that belong on every WhatsApp forward. The music, unsurprisingly, is an instant throwback to Himesh's glory days-auto-tuned, anthemic, and undeniably catchy. The action sequences defy all known laws of physics, the villains are cartoonishly evil, and the plot moves at a breakneck pace, leaving logic gasping for breath in the dust. If you're looking for pure, unfiltered cinematic chaos, Badass Ravikumar is a film that must be seen to be believed.

reviews.title: A cinematic gem
reviews.content: Badass Ravikumar isn't here to win awards; it's here to make sure you have the most fun possible while watching something utterly bonkers. Himesh Reshammiya is the embodiment of pure madness in the lead role, playing a character so impossibly badass that it's almost comical. Every action scene is exaggerated to perfection, featuring explosions, flying kicks, and superhuman feats that are straight out of a superhero comic book-only more absurd. The film's music is a high-energy feast of beats that are destined to get stuck in your head. The dialogues are delivered with such drama that you'll be laughing one minute and cheering the next. The storyline itself is almost an afterthought, with a series of events that make little sense, but who cares when you're watching a rollercoaster of epic proportions? The self-awareness in this film is what makes it so enjoyable-it knows it's ridiculous, and that's what makes it so much fun. Badass Ravikumar is a testament to the fact that sometimes the best way to entertain is by embracing sheer absurdity.

reviews.title: Ravikumar: The Last Stand
reviews.content: Badass Ravikumar is the epitome of pure Bollywood masala, and it knows it. This film is a complete assault on your senses, mixing insane action sequences, quirky dialogues, and a plot so over-the-top, it borders on the absurd. Himesh Reshammiya delivers a performance that's equal parts hilarious and unrelentingly intense, perfectly suited for the rollercoaster ride this film offers. The action feels like it's straight out of a late-night infomercial, but that's part of its charm. Think gravity-defying stunts mixed with an overabundance of slow-motion shots that will have you laughing one minute and nodding in disbelief the next. Himesh's music, a blend of catchy beats and 90s-inspired tracks, keeps your feet tapping throughout, and the dialogues are dripping with melodrama. No need to search for a coherent plot here-Badass Ravikumar is a self-aware, high-energy spectacle that unapologetically embraces its absurdity, and you'll love it for exactly that.

The film is a typical Hindi film that's surprisingly shot well with good enough plot and tonnes of unintentional comedy. Literally, the scenes are not "comedy scenes" but they make you laugh your guts out. If you go watch this film with only the intentions of getting your money's worth you are going to love it. Just don't expect it to change your perspective towards cinema like Interstellar or any genuinely good cinema. Himesh was spectacular with okayish acting and supporting actors were given their own story and well-put character which was fun to watch. This movie will remind you of a lot of other films which is also a good touch I guess. Rest, watch and judge on your own. It was a 10/10 entertainer for me. Worth watching at least once.

reviews.title: Time pass but has it's moments
reviews.content: "Badass Ravi Kumar" is a film that people are calling "so bad it's good," but honestly, I didn't feel that way. There were some enjoyable aspects, but overall, it felt pretty plain and rushed.Visually, the movie is quite vibrant, with colorful frames that stand out. The action sequences were decent, with a few violent moments-though nothing extreme. As for the songs, they didn't work for me at all. I found myself checking my phone whenever they played, so they were entirely forgettable.The story itself doesn't have much going on, but there are moments that might keep you engaged. However, the real highlight is the dialogues. The film delivers some entertaining dialogue-baazi, making almost every line fun to watch. The narration works well too, and I'd say the witty dialogues are the film's biggest strength.On the downside, logic is definitely optional here. The movie even acknowledges that fact, so I didn't bother critically analyzing it. Still, even setting that aside, it felt like the plot just kept moving forward in a rushed manner without much depth.Overall, I went in for the action and dialogues, and those aspects delivered. There were some genuinely amusing moments, and a few lines made me laugh out of sheer amusement. But aside from that, everything else felt average or below average. It's not a parody or an intentional "so bad it's good" film-it just has its moments of fun amidst a fairly forgettable experience.

reviews.title: ..dafaq
reviews.content: Wow. Just... wow. If cinema had a list of crimes against storytelling, this film would be on top. Nay, it would be the undisputed champion of disaster, a shining beacon of how NOT to make a movie. The sheer dedication it takes to make something this atrocious is almost commendable-almost.The story? Oh, it's a masterpiece in cringe. A script seemingly fished out from the trash can of a Bhojpuri Film Industry, dusted off, and smeared with every outdated, cheap, and regressive trope imaginable. The dialogues? Written, I assume, by someone who was either held at gunpoint or actively plotting revenge against cinema itself.And let's talk about the scenes-each one a new, spectacular level of torture. The cheesiness is so thick, it could be sliced and sold in grocery stores. Offensive towards women and transgenders? Oh, absolutely. The filmmakers apparently missed the memo that it's not 1985 anymore. And just when you think it can't get any worse, it throws another painfully unfunny, crass, or outright nauseating moment at you.The music? Let's just say, I'd rather listen to a symphony of car alarms and construction drills. The sets and costumes look like they were borrowed from a low-budget college skit-one that the students themselves abandoned out of shame.Vishwak Sen? Poor guy actually tried. And while effort is admirable, his over confidence and the direction he going not to be encouraged. And the female lead-well, what can we say? She's there, alright. Existing. Not her fault, though. She was clearly just told to stand there, wear whatever minimal fabric was handed to her, and add to the film's overall aesthetic of cheap gimmickry disguised as entertainment.Now, let's be honest: this film doesn't need to be banned. That would imply it has some sort of impact. No, this one is self-sabotaging at an elite level. Give it a day, and it will naturally sink into oblivion, where it belongs. So, Jagan Anna fans, don't even waste your time. This film will destroy itself, no effort needed.Verdict: If you love yourself, avoid this. If you hate yourself, still avoid it. Some bad movies are fun to watch ironically-this isn't one of them. It's just a big, fat, insulting waste of time.

reviews.title: A cringe experience with complete lack of substance
reviews.content: Some films entertain, some challenge, and others-like Laila (2025)-make you wonder how they even made it past the script stage. From start to finish, this film is an unbearable mix of forced humor, poor execution, and an overall lack of direction. It desperately wants to be clever and entertaining, but instead, it stumbles into a mess of cringe-worthy dialogue, flat performances, and painfully outdated tropes.One of the biggest problems with Laila is how little effort it puts into storytelling. Instead of delivering a cohesive or engaging experience, the film meanders aimlessly, relying on lazy jokes and over-the-top antics that fall flat every time. The humor feels forced, the emotional beats are nonexistent, and there's no real sense of purpose. It's as if the filmmakers assumed loud, exaggerated performances and chaotic energy would be enough to carry the film. They weren't.What's worse is that Laila seems to rely on controversy and shock value to gain attention rather than any actual substance. Instead of putting effort into a meaningful or entertaining story, it leans on gimmicks that only highlight how hollow the entire project is.Ultimately, Laila (2025) is a complete misfire, offering nothing but frustration and regret to anyone who sits through it. It's not just a bad film-it's a waste of time. Avoid at all costs.

reviews.title: A Cringe-Inducing Disaster That Shouldn't Exist
reviews.content: Some films are bad, some are forgettable, and then there's Laila (2025)-a movie so painfully unwatchable that it makes you question how it ever got made. What was meant to be a lighthearted comedy ends up being an unbearable, tasteless mess, devoid of charm, intelligence, or even basic storytelling competence.From the very first scene, Laila makes it abundantly clear that subtlety and wit are not on the agenda. The film's plot-if you can call it that-follows Sonu, a beautician who disguises himself as a woman named Laila. This premise had the potential for clever humor, but instead, we get a barrage of cringe-inducing gags, offensive stereotypes, and juvenile slapstick that feels like it was written by someone who thinks humor peaked in the early 2000s.Vishwak Sen's performance is, at best, a lesson in overacting and, at worst, an absolute embarrassment. Whether he's playing Sonu or Laila, his exaggerated mannerisms and forced comedic timing make it impossible to take anything seriously. The supporting cast fares no better, either sleepwalking through their lines or hamming it up to an unbearable degree. It's as if everyone involved realized midway through filming that they were part of a train wreck but had already signed their contracts.The direction by Ram Narayan is shockingly incompetent. Scenes are cobbled together with no sense of pacing, comedic timing, or emotional weight. The cinematography is bland, the editing is choppy, and the film feels at least an hour longer than it actually is. Every joke drags on for what feels like an eternity, making the movie less of a comedy and more of an endurance test.And then there's the film's desperate attempt to stir controversy, which only highlights how little substance it has to offer. Even the marketing relied on cheap gimmicks and sensationalism, as if the filmmakers knew the content itself was beyond saving. But no amount of controversy can distract from the sheer laziness on display here.Simply put, Laila is an insult to its audience. It's the kind of movie that doesn't just waste your time but actively makes you regret ever pressing play. If there's one thing to take away from this disaster, it's a valuable lesson: just because something gets greenlit doesn't mean it should have been made. Avoid this mess at all costs.

reviews.title: Nothing short of a disaster

The so-called romantic track between Vishwak Sen and Aakanksha Sharma is poorly executed, relying more on skin show than genuine chemistry. The supporting cast, despite being packed with experienced actors, is wasted on one-dimensional roles that add little to the film.Comedy, which should have been a major strength, falls flat due to an overuse of double-meaning dialogues and crude humor that grows tiresome. The attempt to incorporate Hyderabad Old City slang for laughs backfires, making the humor feel forced rather than organic. To make matters worse, the film drags on with unnecessary fight sequences and forgettable songs, further exposing the lack of fresh ideas.Vishwak Sen has proven his acting chops in the past, but Laila shows that he seems to believe excessive cuss words and below-the-belt jokes are enough to draw in audiences. Unfortunately, it results in an exhausting and forgettable watch.

reviews.title: There is neither Condor Heroes nor Heroes, not even Jin Yong.
reviews.content: A shoddy pseudo-wuxia film, claiming to be adapted from a Jin Yong novel, lacks basic story content and has absolutely no character development. While the original work doesn't focus heavily on this particular section, the movie essentially throws together fragments of the novel randomly, resembling a mashup of online short dramas. Although the subtitle is "The Greatest Hero," the film's limited runtime makes it impossible to both depict the protagonist's growth process and have him instantly become a great hero. After all, at this point in the original novel, Guo Jing's martial arts skills are just beginning to take shape, and his understanding of "The Greatest Hero" is not yet profound. This character arc of growth actually develops in the next installment, "The Return of the Condor Heroes." The director's attempt to force the protagonist into becoming a great hero in this film can only be described as 'trying to draw a tiger but ending up with a dog' - a complete failure.

reviews.title: An excellent movie

reviews.title: A Stunning Epic from a Master
reviews.content: Tsui Hark one again delivers a visually breathtaking film. The fight sequences are powerful and intense, the performances shine of the young cast. I found especially refreshing thos portrayal of Guo Jing who is no longer naive but a strong upright warrior. Huang Rong is heroic and resourceful, while Hua Zheng is a proud and battle-hardened princess. Not to mention, they are all very beautiful people. My favourite Tony Leung Ka Fai's who plays Ouyang Feng is both intense and humorous.The plot focuses on Guo Jing's growth from a skilled fighter to a hero who understands war's true cost. The nostalgic 1983 theme song will hit you right in the feels too.This adaptation is a must-watch for Tsui Hark fans and those who love the novel. But those who are not familiar with the story can still enjoy the movie, since the script gives you an understanding of the characters backstory and historical background.

reviews.title: This is the movie that I want to watch
reviews.content: I have always been impressed by Tsui Hark's camera aesthetics. The movie is very enjoyable, with beautiful and romantic visuals, laughter, tears, and shock. I will watch many times to learn. With magnificent war scenes, exquisite martial arts fighting, and profound patriotism, it brings a pure martial arts feast. The martial world is still the same,this version of Guo Jing to truly embody the righteous spirit of chivalry,which exceeds my expectations. The friendship between two lovely girls, Huazheng and Huang Rong, is the best,but unfortunately, childhood sweethearts can't compare to chance encounters. I want to revisit Jin Yong's novels again.

reviews.title: A match made in heaven
reviews.content: As a franchise based on a series of books that are brilliantly written, nationally acknowledged, beloved and familiarised by Chinese people, it already had loads of adaptations, but one dilemma this classic franchise is facing is on one side, the older generations who are familiar with the story and various of versions filmed previously already have a clear idea about who they think the story, the characters are, it will be really hard to offer them a different version and gain acknowledgment from them; on the other side, it takes considerations to think about how to reach out to the younger generations who perceive this franchise as already out of date. I've been a Tsui Hark fan for years and I have believe in him on his vision and abilities on handling wuxia genre, that's why I felt so excited since I knew this project, and it actually didn't disappoint me.First because everyone cares a lot about whether the actors fit the well-loved characters, I'm gonna guarantee you that they all get it so right! I knew there are actor with zero acting experience in the cast but overall their actings are so incredibly sophisticated I was actually in awe, I think that's where Tsui Hark's ability of instructing, monitoring and adjusting actors' performance kicks in, he's really good at it! Btw one thing I loved about Guo Jing's portrayal was I had this feeling that he had intentionally made the Mongolian lines slight ly more fluent than Chinese lines which matches Guo Jing's background (he grew up in Mongol), as a Chinese actor I knew it takes effort to make it happen!Back to the movie itself, that scene Guo Jing and Huang Rong running towards each other in rain was so beautifully filmed and incredibly touching, I actually cried at that moment and strongly feel this is THAT moment I'm gonna ruminate for a long while.The fight scenes were so well-thought and designed so easy to understand how it works, which is what I think always good in Tsui Hark's films, the visual communication never failsI also like the way this film dealing with what we called identity crisis nowadays, our debate was no longer what identity you are, is it where you grew up or where you originally from? GJ's answer after going through all sort of things: its actually the care for ppl mattersI'm not a moviegoer but I had this gut feeling like I am kinda a Tsui Hark fan and I've watched most of his works and I can confidently say when ppl vertically compare this legendary director's works on the timeline and talk about it LOCH will be the work you can always find something interesting.

reviews.title: A must-watch for Jin Yong fans
reviews.content: This is a movie with rich plot and excellent special effects. As a fan of Jin Yong, I am very happy to see The Legend of the Condor Heroes directed by Tsui Hark. This movie has a concise and compact plot, excellent special effects, the leading actors are all very photogenic and their acting skills are also very good. The shots shot by Tsui Hark are very beautiful, and it is especially cool to watch them in the IMAX theater! The character "Guo Jing" played by Xiao Zhan fits the image in my mind very well. His actions are very smooth and it is obvious that he has put a lot of effort into it. The actresses who played Huang Rong and Hua Zheng also did a great job, and Tony Leung's Ouyang Feng was even more outstanding. All in all, it is a highly recommended movie!

reviews.title: This time, Tsui Hark didn't "magically" edit Jin Yong
reviews.content: Director Tsui Hark's "The Legend of the Condor Heroes: The Greatest Hero" uses "The Greatest Hero" as a subtitle. Naturally, the focus is not on the earlier romantic entanglements and feuds of the Jianghu, but on the final war. However, this film is not a war movie, but an anti-war movie. At the beginning of the film, it takes just ten minutes to clarify the content of the first few dozen chapters of the original work. If you have written a novel or screenplay, you know how difficult this is. The screenwriter is Tsui Hark himself, and I guess he must have conceived it a long time ago. Congratulations to Tsui Hark.The best part is that although Tsui Hark seems to have made many changes, after compression, it is very faithful to the original, especially in the restoration of the male protagonist Guo Jing. It has always been thought that the dramatization of the TV series does not generally focus on the last few chapters, and Guo Jing's important growth stages are ignored, making this character less attractive to audiences than Huang Rong. Xiao Zhan's portrayal of Guo Jing matches the character I imagined while reading the book: determined, persistent, and responsible. His initial simplicity upon entering central China is due to him growing up on the grassland without Jianghu experience.Tsui Hark's cinematography remains beautiful, the actors are excellent, the special effects are pleasing, the fight scenes are cleverly designed, and the plot rhythm demands full concentration. It is a great movie-watching experience.

reviews.title: Really good wuxia movie
reviews.content: Anyone into Chinese cinema has heard of Tsui Hark. Cinematography and use of music was dynamic and nostalgic, it took me right back to the peak of Hong Kong cinema. The storytelling was compelling and moving, overall a very good film to watch with your kids or your parents. It's also a complete blockbuster that sweeps you right into the thick of the battle scenes.I really enjoyed Tony Leung's character, he seems to be such a sincere antagonist and had the whole theatre in stitches with his antics.If I had to pick something to criticize, it would be that certain scenes appeared to be removed from the final cut, such as the scenes where Guo Jing led the Mongol army, which I feel could've really added to his characterisation and the motives behind his actions. Not sure why this edit was made - to reduce the length of the film perhaps?Nonetheless, I found this movie to be thoroughly entertaining. Highly recommended for anyone who wants to be swept up in a moving narrative, great storywriting, moving acting and overall a good time.

reviews.title: Wonderful
reviews.content: Just finished watching it, the pictures are so beautiful, and the story of the hero and heroine is so touching! Separated in the most beautiful season and reunited in the rainy world, the director breaks the general stereotype to retell the story, which is very special. Due to time limitations, many things cannot be explained in detail, but we can still feel the cruelty of war from the film. Peace is very important, and it takes great courage for the protagonist to come out and stop the war. I hope everyone has the opportunity to watch the film and cherish the hard-won peace!! I hope there will be more people like the protagonist in this world.

reviews.title: The Best Movie for the family to watch!
reviews.content: The most sought successful best movie for the family "The Legend of Condor Heroes:The Gallants" . This was made with dedication by the multi awarded genius director Tsui Hark who is highly faithful to the original work and his desire to bring the essence of the novel and adapt it to the big screen to allow the audience to feel the heroic spirit! Excellent! 100% best movie the I can be proud of and treasure it all my life.

reviews.title: An epic masterpiece worth watching
reviews.content: When I was a child, I often saw rows of old Jin Yong novels in my grandfather's bookshelf. When I was bored, I liked to flip through them. This was my earliest martial arts enlightenment. I didn't expect Tsui Hark to bring it to the big screen, so I took my family to watch it together. On the scene, the language of the camera is excellent. When it's romantic, it's romantic; when it's grand, it's shocking. As it's a real-life shooting, the desert sand, mountains, and rivers in the camera are very eye-catching. I don't know where the director found such a beautiful place. In terms of the characters, there are all kinds of ugly characters. The actors portray each character plumply. Guo Jing is chivalrous and upright, Huang Rong is smart and intelligent, the Chinese zither is free and decisive, the sweat is not angry and arrogant, Ouyang Feng is paranoid and unlucky (to the end, a little distressed). The rest of the funny responsibilities of the Beggars' Sect will not be repeated. The female characters portrayed by Tsui Hark are too well crafted. Women are not only delicate, sensitive, and charming, but also free spirited, brave, and cunning. Women naturally have a sense of empathy and identification with each other (I really dislike female competition!).In terms of music, it perfectly matches the plot. When the opening song plays countrymen DNA, it moves people into the world of martial arts. The Mongolian songs at the end of the film are bold and unrestrained, and the mood is lifted after listening to them. This time, I watched it with my family of eighteen, without any bloody, borderline, or intimate scenes. The plot is full of laughter and tears, making it perfect for the whole family to go to the cinema together. For me, it's a five-star movie, but even after watching it, I still feel unsatisfied and will immerse myself in watching it for a second time.

reviews.title: Meaningful, Fast-paced (Non-Mandarin's Tips)
reviews.content:
Meaningful, fast-paced movie, with breathtaking sceneries.Story's ultimate focus on Guo Jing's inner struggle, and how he coped with the conflicts between Song (his ancestral homeland) and Mongolia (where he was raised by a loving royal family).Ending has a beautiful meaning for present times --- when there's so much war and hate.(Real heroes are not about muscles and power, but about the heart for the greater good of the people.)***

To appreciate the story details, you need some prior-background knowledge of Guo Jing, or you may find yourself too focused on the captions and miss a lot in this fast-paced (with various flashbacks) movie.A decent theater is a MUST for the stunning sceneries and effect.*** ***

reviews.title: One of the best movies

reviews.title: An Epic Journey: Stunning Action and Deep Emotion Unfold on Screen
reviews.content: Legends of the Condor Heroes: Xia Zhi Da Zhe is a true cinematic masterpiece. The emotional depth of the characters and the moral dilemmas they face truly stand out.Under the expert direction of Xu Ke, the film delivers breathtaking visuals and epic action sequences that stay true to the spirit of the original novel. The production is top-notch, with stunning costumes, beautiful landscapes, and intricately choreographed fight scenes that keep you on the edge of your seat.Xiao Zhan's portrayal of Guo Jing is nothing short of extraordinary. His presence on screen captures the strength, loyalty, and vulnerability of the character, making him a perfect fit for this iconic role. His martial arts skills and the depth he brings to the character elevate the film to another level.Overall, Legends of the Condor Heroes: Xia Zhi Da Zhe is a must-watch for any fan of martial arts films. The combination of strong storytelling, excellent direction, and outstanding performances makes it one of the most anticipated films of the year.

reviews.title: Good film

reviews.title: A Thrilling Wuxia Epic: Legends of the Condor Heroes
reviews.content: My friend in China saw it and couldn't stop raving about the stunning fight scenes and gripping storyline. The cinematography is top-notch, and Xiao Zhan's performance as Guo Jing is fantastic. It's a fresh yet faithful take on a wuxia classic, packed with emotion and energy. If you're into martial arts films, this one's a must-watch.The action sequences are beautifully choreographed, blending intensity with elegance. Every fight feels meaningful, not just flashy. The film also does a great job capturing the heart of Jin Yong's novel, balancing epic battles with deep character moments. The visuals are breathtaking, and the pacing keeps you hooked from start to finish. Whether you're a longtime wuxia fan or new to the genre, The Gallants is a thrilling ride that's absolutely worth seeing on the big screen.

reviews.title: Awesome Female Characters
reviews.content: To be honest, it is really hard to find well written female characters in some male centered movies especially wuxia genre. In every adapting version of LOCH novel, I found many female characters not given justice.But the Tsui Hark's 2025 version probably gives me the best ever Princess Hua Zheng who's intelligent and brave and loving Guo Jing in her own ways. She stands up for what she believes it's right and always keeping promise. Even found out Huang Rong's secret, she had a fair battle with her. In some early adaptions she was portrayed just as an annoying people in a typical love triangle and her relationship with Guo Jing was not convincing.Yet the new Hua Zheng is really the highlight of the movie and Xiao Zhan's portray of Guo Jing making her obsessed love more believable. Audience can feel more connected into those intensive love triangle scenes.Also lots of love for Huang Rong and Guo Jing's mother. They're the heart of the movie and touching my heart greatly.

reviews.title: Very good film
reviews.content: Love the details, the acting, the high quality of the film. What is pity is the beginning when introducing the background it is too rush and not very attractive. The beginning part is the worst part of the film, after it gets better and better and i feel it is a great film at the end, which even make me almost forget the weakness part of the beginning.People who likes high quality film will love it. reviews.title: A Romantic Story Not to Be Missed
reviews.content: Guo Jing is one of the most outstanding characters in Chinese martial arts novels. Compassionate towards ordinary people, he gave up high - ranking positions and great wealth in Mongolia, chose to safeguard the peace of the border regions of Song density, and ultimately sacrificed his life for this cause. The film features extraordinary lighting and visual effects, particularly romantic. The actor Xiao Zhan has depicted an extremely upright and reliable knight - errant image, and his acting skills have won wide acclaim. Director Tsui Hark is among the most outstanding directors in the realm of martial arts films. He has always been adept at using romantic cinematic language in his works, and is also known for his creative adaptations of original novels.

reviews.title: Excellent special effects!
reviews.content: The special effects of The Legend of the Condor Heroes are excellent. Watching it in the IMAX theater was extremely shocking, especially the fighting scene between Guo Jing and Ouyang Feng, which was very enjoyable to watch! Tsui Hark is still as skilled as ever, and within 146 minutes he expressed many important plots in the last few chapters of The Legend of the Condor Heroes in a simple and easy-to-understand way. Although some plots have been slightly changed from the original, the changes are reasonable and the plot is also very coherent. The pace is very brisk, the war and fighting scenes are excellent, and the love scenes are also beautifully shot. The performances of all the actors were outstanding and very consistent with their roles. A highly recommended movie!

reviews.title: It lacked something.
reviews.content: The movie is decent, it is not the best. It is not memorable.The charaters seems to be lacking... something. I can't pinpoint exactly what, but their expressions felt stiff. By stiff I mean that there wasn't a variety of it? The female lead and the male lead seem to be on a similar level of acting performance, but that doesn't mean it is extraordinary, it is just "decent".There were some clear issues with the wirework in some scenes. The production tried to make it up for it with the effect, but in some scenes it is just too noticeable. There were also some changes made... yeah.It is a movie that I wouldn't watch again, but to pass some time it is good or to put it at the back while I am doing something else.If there is a sequel I will check it out, but I will adjust my expectations then.

reviews.title: Worst adaptation ever
reviews.content: The worst adaptation of the beloved Jin Yong's work. LOTCH is a martial art/kungfu novel but here, the movie focused more on the war stories.The characters are so two-dimensional that they seemed flatter than the pages of the book. The only saving grace is the character of Hua Zhen, the Mongolian princess which received more airplay here than otherwise in other drama adaptation.The kungfu skills amd fight scenes are so ridiculous, heavily laden with CGI that could put any Marvel superheroes to shame.Without the financial backing of China, Tsui Hark would have gone into oblivion long ago. With such audacious, ridiculous movie, it's time he should.

reviews.title: Best Wuxia film
reviews.content: In Tsui Hark's martial arts universe, he masterfully blends the chaos of the Jianghu world with the solitary pride of its heroes. The "Eighteen Subduing Dragon Palms" under his lens transcend mere martial arts choreography-when those palm strikes sweep across the silver screen, the ink-wash Jianghu from Jin Yong's novels suddenly transforms into a flowing epic of light and shadow. Fluttering robes leaping between rooftops, the glint of humanity flashing through sword clashes-these moments resemble the genetic code of martial arts culture awakening in modern cinema. Tsui's genius lies in deconstructing classical chivalry through contemporary visual language: when Qiao Feng unleashes dragon-shaped qi that swallows mountains and rivers with twin palm strikes, audiences witness not just spectacular VFX, but the explosive rebirth of a millennia-old chivalric spirit. Every frame thrums with patriotic fervor and tender heroism, crafting a soul-stirring saga that lingers long after the credits roll.

reviews.title: Everybody, go see it.!This movie is super cool!
reviews.content:
When I first saw the title of the film, I had a little question. Why does the title of the film have to add a hero at the end? But when I finished watching the movie that question was answered. In the film, the Mongol Khan said: "Guo Jing, I established the land, there is a year's journey, do you think that the world, what is the real hero?"
Guo Jing replied: "I think that the real hero does not rely on martial arts, but can stand up in the crisis, always have compassion."There are not only moves to rekindle the blood of martial arts, but also many moments that make people smile. Ouyang Feng in the face of subordinates questions and Guo Jing the results of the competition "each other, can be said to be a narrow victory ~"; Beggars and Huang Rong pass the message when the funny and so on. The film is not only blindly promoting martial arts, every audience can find their own heart.

reviews.title: 146 minutes gone too fast!
reviews.content:
Legends Of The Condor Heroes: The Gallants is so exciting! 146 minutes gone too fast! I had high expectations, and it was so worth it!The whole movie is so well-made, the special effects are amazing, Xiao Zhan is wonderful, the female characters are so beautiful and strong!Tsui Hark made a great movie!(Stay through the final credits. There's more)
I watched it in Frankfurt, Germany, on the 2nd day of the release, the 30th, and the theatre was full. The audience was enthralled!The cinema had the wrong ratio on that day, and the subtitles were cut off, but I was lucky I already knew the story, and some Mandarin. I'm going to watch it again, though.It is worth rewatching!

reviews.title: Entertaining but partially of canon
reviews.content: The movie is shot with great cinematography and does a good job detailing how Guo jing his Mongolian past, and how he learns various wu gong as in the novels. It also summarizes his and Huang Rong's relationship quite concisely and well at the beginning. However, the ending part of the movie does feel a bit forced unfortunately which is bad. In the canon, they never show Ou Yang Feng taking on a whole Mongolian army. While it does make for interesting cinematography and defines Guo Jing as a righteous character these events never happen in the novels. Other than that though, the movie is good and other plot gaps are excusable and I think they did a good job at weaving together the story albeit with some plot holes. Think overall I'd give it a 7.5 but feel any movie about condor heroes probably would need a trilogy such like lord of the rings or Batman to go into the full depth about characters and backstories without misinterpreting canon.

reviews.title: Really enjoyable.
reviews.content: Fast-paced, great cinematography, strong acting from the cast (personal favorites are the actors who plays Guo Jing, Ouyang Feng and Li Ping) and a rich plot that keeps the viewers engaged throughout the whole movie. The fighting scenes are great, especially the final one between Guo Jing and Ouyang Feng. There were funny moments and parts that made me cry as well. Tsui Hark's masterful storytelling and great visuals remain strong.2 hours and 26 minutes whizzed by and suddenly it ended, I really didn't feel the length at all it was really good and enjoyable from start to finish. It brought back the nostalgia of watching wuxia dramas and films from when I was little.Oh, make sure to stay and watch the post-credit scene!I hope director Tsui Hark gives us a sequel.

reviews.title: Excellent film
reviews.content: Tsui Hark does not disappoint me. Its staging is wonderful and the landscapes of northern China are beautiful.The aerial and ground shots are incredible. You can see the emotion in every scene presented.This proposal by Tsui Hark is novel and its characters are very well chosen.This time the modern Guo Jing does not present himself as the fool described in the books, but gradually grows in knowledge and evolves in thought, because he is intelligent.The performance of all the characters is artistic and very well presented. The martial arts of this movie are interesting; they do not always show the violence seen in some film genres, but they form a philosophy to show that not everything is war and resentment.Very good and I recommend it.

title: 77. A Hard Place
runtime: A Hard Place: Directed by J. Horton. With Felissa Rose, Lynn Lowry, Rachel Amanda Bryant, Kevin Caliber. A group of criminals on the run find themselves caught in the middle of an ancient feud between the monsters that roam the day and the creatures that rule the night.

reviews.title: Spectacular
reviews.content: An amazing movie I plan on sharing with many friends and family once released on DVD or a streaming platform.Enjoyed the homestead feeling of the setting and the characters that called it home. Loved each monsters costume and effects along with the transformations between the two.Nice and gory, with a lot of fun humor thrown in. reviews.title: Felissa Rose and relative newcomers "bring it home"!
reviews.content: It's my understanding that this film started out in crowdfunding. Many crowdfunded films are simply unwatchable on account of the bad acting and low production value. This movie is quite different. reviews.title: Going Places succeeds in takeing the audience places.
reviews.content: Going Places starring Ethan Cutkosky (Shameless, Alex/October), Spence Moore II (All American, Brilliant Minds) and Chloe East (Generation) takes us on an adventure with the best friend trio of Otis, Jaden and Cora!Ready for a fun getaway together before the next chapter of their lives begins we soon find each friend has a hidden obstacle they're dealing with but those are put on hold when they suddenly run into a woman and her suitcase of a million dollars!The night turns into a wild ride dealing with an allegedly dead woman and the millions in her possession! Who is she? Where did she come from? Should they take the money and run? There's much on the table for them!Throughout the night in the midst of the chaos things are discovered that will test the friendship of our main trio along with some experimentation that could also bring them closer together.Ethan Cutkosky is a highlight (along with his blonde highlights in the film) as Otis!A character not really sure of what he wants in more ways than one and not feeling on the level of "special" that his two best friends are or so he thinks. He also nails some funny one liners one of my faves in particular being from the first fire scene when they discover something about the woman they hit with their car.I really appreciated how a certain aspect of Otis's character was handled aswell that you don't often see in most films or tv series!Spence Moore II does a wonderful job as Jaden and really brings across the character that everyone would want to be friends with even though we learn things aren't so perfect in his world either.Chloe East shines in her role of Cora as well and definitely brought some laughs for me along with bringing the chops during the intense scenes.Going Places gives us thrills, comedy and action with plenty of twists and turns along the way with tender and heartfelt moments mixed in too! It makes for a lovely directorial debut from Max Chernov!Check out this wonderful little gem of a film! :)

title: 86. Ambrogio: The First Vampire

reviews.title: A refreshing take on vampires
reviews.content: I recently watched a new vampire film called Ambrogio : The First Vampire, and it was SO different than what I expected it to be. We've all seen a vampire movie before, and they all tend to be fairly similar to one another. You go into the film with an expectation.Well, Ambrogio : The First Vampire completely blew that away. Far different than the average blood sucker flick, this movie is completely original, beyond pleasantly original!It's a really exciting movie made completely independently, the whole cast and crew are all indie gems.The movie features a really rich story filled with vibrant characters, incredible locations, ace cinematography; it's exciting and you can visibly tell while watching this how much effort and time and hard work the cast and crew put into making the film.For me personally, when I watch a movie like this I feel so rewarded by the end, just being able to watch independent artists making art, and Ambrogio : The First Vampire definitely makes you feel that way while watching!I had such fun watching this movie, and I'd love for you to take a BITE out of Ambrogio : The First Vampire!Get it? Bite? Cuz vampires, they..bite. It's funny!Okay, I'm sorry. I wanted to end it with a laugh. I tried. Watch the movie, it's a refreshing new take on the vampire genre with a lot of heart made by some really strong artists. I hope you see it and enjoy it as much as I did.

reviews.title: FRESH. HOT. REWATCHABLE.

Heck, if you rent/buy the stream or venture into Walmart and buy the dvd, I wouldn't be opposed to hanging out and watching it again with you. Given the distance, of course.I hope that tells you how strongly I feel about this incredible film.Congratulations to the cast and crew.

reviews.title: Interesting watch
reviews.content: Overall, I enjoyed the movie. I did not know the story of the "original" vampire, so kudos for writing a good story! There were some memorable dialogue and lines. While Hades and Dracula were important to the story, I never fully got the evil vibe from them. Special effects were good. I wasn't able to feel connected to the character Ambrogio. His troubled soul yearned to be free, but it took a long time for him to find his peace. Nice touch to include some Italian and Greek dialogue in the movie.

reviews.title: An Impressive Debut
reviews.content: Ambrogio is a very impressive achievement for a first-time feature-length director, writer, and crew. Coming in at about 1 hour and 10 minutes, it's a respectable length that doesn't try to go too high too quickly. Even with the small budget, the story and its implications carry greater weight and scope, and the effective location choices help lend the right amount of credibility to these elements.I was also impressed by the unique take on the vampire mythos by taking things back to their furthest roots and developing a character whose origins lie in the birthplace of vampirism. That sort of ancient mythos and lore is always exciting in fiction and fantasy.I think the most successful elements of Alex Javo's film are the actors (especially Mitch Lemos as Hades and Niko'a Salas as Dracula), the music, and the costuming.My one critique for the film, given the subject matter, is I wish a darker lighting scheme and perhaps even color palette had been used to accentuate the macabe and gothic nature of our vampire characters, especially in Ambrogio's home. The use of high contrast or back-lit shots would have lent to showing us a creepier or more mysterious side to Ambrogio.That said, I think Alex and the film greatly succeed in what they set out to do, and its praise and accolades from the indie film community are well deserved.

reviews.title: The Best Film of 2025
reviews.content: The Security Guard (2025) is a gripping and emotionally charged film that brings suspense and heart together in a way few films can. At the heart of the story is Omari Russell (played by an incredible lead actor), a single father from Brooklyn who, after being disqualified from the NYPD, becomes a School Safety Officer. His protective instincts are put to the ultimate test when a school shooting occurs at his daughter Mya's school, forcing Omari to face his greatest fear head-on. It's a story of love, courage, and determination in the face of unimaginable danger.What stands out most about The Security Guard is how the film crafts a deeply human story within a thrilling, high-stakes scenario. Omari's journey is emotional and intense, but it's the supporting cast that really shines here, adding incredible depth and nuance to the story. From his daughter Mya, who plays a pivotal role in Omari's emotional drive, to the other characters within the school, each performance adds something unique to the narrative. Their reactions to the crisis, their relationships with Omari, and their individual arcs make the world feel lived in and real.The pacing of the film is expertly done, balancing quiet, reflective moments with moments of heart-stopping action. The tension builds steadily, with the threat of the shooting never overshadowing the emotional core of the story Omari's love for his daughter and his determination to protect her. The film knows when to slow down and allow the characters to breathe, giving you time to really connect with them before throwing you into the next heart-pounding moment.

reviews.title: Mikhail Red's best horror to date.
reviews.content: This is a well-crafted cult horror thriller and one of the best of its kind by local film standards. The story is well-structured and effectively executed. The lead performances by Heaven, Eula, and Ryza were spot-on, with each delivering strong portrayals of their respective characters. The film incorporates the Filipino myth of "Lilim" (worshippers of the demon Lilith), which adds a unique and well-thought-out element to the narrative.While the pacing starts slow, the way the story unfolds keeps you intrigued, raising questions that compel you to watch closely. There are a fair number of jump scares, especially when viewed in a good theater. Though the concept, twists, and overall story aren't entirely unique, the performances and execution elevate it above the average horror film.I believe this surpasses the quality of Eerie and Deleter, and it's disappointing that it didn't receive the recognition it deserves. What I admire about Mikhail Red's films is his reliance on atmosphere and practical effects rather than excessive CGI. In my opinion, this is his best 'horror' work to date.

reviews.title: Pure Bala hunting ground...
reviews.content: Bala makes his 9 millionth movie with the Pithamagan script. His rooting for the unsung, brutal heroes from the lower stratas of the society gets exposed again. The usual cringey female comedy track slows down proceedings. The bad guys...yes bad guys deserves no mercy...they are...IMPALED, and the mayhem is Bala¬©.Bala shoots most of the portions realistically but action scenes does not feel organic. Mysskin cracked some whip briefly,he leaves an impact. The Police and court proceedings look authentic,just like every other Bala feature.Top notch cinematography, average Music-didnt pack the required punch,Action tries hard to be disturbingly violent but fails. Arun Vijay lives his role, he demolishes everything in his path and gives no ****, he deserved a hit with Vangaan.

reviews.title: Who is Bala???
reviews.content: The first revelation is that its a role loosely traced from Bala's all time classic hit 'Pithamagan' Vikram character and the second fact is that he is going to carry the entire film by hurting the weaker section of the human race...What Bala seems to have likely forgotten is that his previous movies had strong emotional plots...He has to failed to nail it perfectly and has come up with a weak story blindly banking his trust on concept of 'Victimising the weak' and gaining sympathy out of it, thereby letting the protagonist vent out his fury. Unfortunately, lack of proper screenplay leaves us restless and bored throughout the film...The whole first half keeps us clueless where is the story progressing, and the conflict opens only by interval. The post-interval scenes are too predictable, and despite the director's ability to bring in familiar faces like Mysskin and Samuthirakani, it doesn't help the film from sinking. Nonetheless, what needs to be appreciated is the unconditional dedication of Arun Vijay and Roshini Prakash. Mysskin's cameo is good, and Samuthirakani's character is okay...Bala's smartness in delivering religious sarcasm was appreciated in all his movies, but he seems to be purposely injected it into this movie for no reason. Sam CS's background score is commendable, and his hard work is evident in every single scene. GV Prakash's melodious numbers are soul-stirring. Overall, it's high time Bala unlearns and tries to explore the unexplored. He has already delivered emblematic masterpieces, thereby letting many amateur and upcoming directors to get inspired by his work. However, it's disappointing to see that he has started replicating his own movies again. Hope he bounces back soon...

reviews.title: Movie Actors/Director
reviews.content: City Rush 4 Review"City Rush 4" is a fast-paced action movie that keeps you entertained from start to finish. Director George Tounas does a great job making sure the action never slows down. The movie is packed with car chases, fight scenes, and exciting moments that keep you hooked the whole way through.Eric Roberts, a well-known actor, really stands out in this film. He brings a lot of energy and experience to his role, making every scene he's in even better. He has that cool, confident style that makes him fun to watch, and he helps give the movie a strong and interesting feel.One of the biggest surprises in this movie is Krishna Gandhi. I used to see him on TikTok, and now he's acting in a big action film! It's really cool to see him make this jump, and he does a great job. Even with experienced actors around him, he holds his own and makes his character feel real. It's exciting to see new talent like him getting a chance to shine.What makes "City Rush 4" even better is that it's not just about action. The story is actually interesting, with some twists and funny moments that keep things fun. The movie doesn't just throw in explosions and fights-it gives you characters you actually care about.The way the movie is filmed is also really impressive. The action scenes make you feel like you're right there in the middle of it all. The fight scenes are well-done, the car chases are intense, and the special effects look great without being too much. You can tell a lot of effort went into making the movie feel real and exciting.Overall, "City Rush 4" is a fun, action-packed movie that's definitely worth watching. George Tounas does a great job as the director, Eric Roberts delivers another solid performance, and Krishna Gandhi is a fresh new face who really surprised me. Whether you're a fan of the series or just looking for a great action movie, this one won't disappoint!

reviews.title: Waste of 5 hours
reviews.content: At least, that's what I felt as this movie dragged on forever, filled with outdated, lame jokes and absolute brainrot. I understand that it's an old film, but even for its time, it's terrible. There's a difference between something aging poorly and something that was never good to begin with, this falls into the latter category. Every minute felt like an eternity, and I kept saying this to myself "why am I still watching this?".The pacing is another major issue. Movies like this make me question my entire existence. If I wanted to waste my time I could have just stared at a blank wall for two hours. At least that would have been less painful.

reviews.title: Sundar.c Supremacy
reviews.content: After many months, I left the theater feeling satisfied. The movie follows a simple and predictable storyline but is filled with classic elements of "OG" Sundar C, along with the signature comedy of "OG" Santhanam.This film was made 12 years ago, but it's only being released now, and it still feels fresh. The standout feature of the movie is Santhanam, who single-handedly carries the film with his impeccable comedic timing. Every scene he's in is met with laughter from the audience. At one point, I even had a stomach ache from laughing so hard. The final 15-20 minutes, which feature Santhanam, the late Mano Bala, and others, are particularly memorable and had the theater in stitches. It's also worth noting the five songs typical of a Tamil film and some illogical fight sequences. While unrealistic, we still enjoyed them in the theater. At times, I felt like we'd missed these elements in the last 10 years of cinema.I'm truly grateful to have watched this film. I don't understand why Santhanam isn't acting as comedian because every time he delivered a line, the theater erupted with laughter. The director, known for his comedy, has recently moved on to making horror films with lackluster comedic elements. He's one of the finest comedy directors, and I hope this movie's success encourages him to return to this genre.This is a complete theater experience-an ordinary movie made extraordinary by its comedic sequences. It's a family-friendly film, though some of the glamourous moments might lean into comedy a bit too much.Finally, my request is this: if Tamil cinema could create a movie like this 12 years ago, why are modern directors making such boring films? It's disappointing for both their reputation and their fans. I hope this trend changes soon.

I felt VARLAKSHMI would have had a different film carrier if this movie would have been released on time. A classic SundarC masala mixed mass entertainer.

reviews.title: Mokka comedy, mokka padam but....I wasn't bored.

reviews.title: Brain Dead...!!!
reviews.content:
This decade-plus delay is a crucial factor in understanding the film...If you were a fan of Sundar C's brand of comedy from the early 2010s, particularly his collaborations with Santhanam, this film might offer a nostalgic trip. Santhanam's one-liners and comedic timing are often cited as the biggest strength of the movie...
Vishal is said to deliver an acceptable performance in his role. The female leads, Anjali and Varalaxmi Sarathkumar, add a touch of glamour and perform adequately within their limited scope...The film doesn't take itself seriously, and if you go in expecting a no-brainer entertainer with plenty of comedy, you might find it a decent timepass. It aims to provide laughs and some action without much depth...
Vijay Antony's songs and background score were decent, though not particularly memorable...The most significant drawback is that the film feels very much like a product of its time (early 2010s). The humor, the plot, and even the technical aspects can feel dated compared to contemporary Tamil cinema...
The story is simple and lacks engagement. The pacing can be slow, making the film feel dull at times. The screenplay is considered weak and inconsistent...A recurring criticism is the presence of jokes that are now considered sexist, body-shaming, and generally crude. What might have been acceptable (though still questionable) over a decade ago doesn't sit well with many modern audiences...Sonu Sood's villain character is portrayed as a typical, old-school antagonist, lacking any novelty. The hero-villain face-offs are not impactful, and the climax fight is considered too long and anticlimactic...
The editing and cinematography are generally considered unimpressive and below average...Overall:"Madha Gaja Raja" is a film heavily impacted by its long delay. While it might offer some nostalgic laughs for fans of early 2010s Tamil comedy, particularly Santhanam's work, it largely feels outdated in terms of its story, humor, and technical execution.

reviews.title: 80's 90's action with modern production quality
reviews.content: This film was a great surprise. I'm used to so many new movies just being the same old, using typical modern sound effects, and effects using CGI. This one is so different. The practical effects make it stand out and above any other recent independent film. It's 80's 90's action but with the quality of a modern studio film. The original sound score is really well done and further ups the quality of the film. The fact that is uses a song by The Platters just takes it over the top. The Platters were one of the most successful vocal groups back in the day and in independent film, you just don't see this. The movie is well written, well acted (even though it lacks any well known actor), and well produced. Congratulations to all involved in making this movie. Had this movie been from a major studio, I would have given it a 5. But the fact its an independent that can stand with the studio films is big, so I give it an 8. Well done.

reviews.title: Intriguing introduction to a universe I want to see more of.
reviews.content: Full disclosure: I was privileged to be able to do a little work on Black Zone, and consider several of the people involved to be among my favorite people in the Kansas City film community, so this is not an unbiased review.I'll start with my main complaint about the film. It was originally meant to be a series, but was condensed into feature-length when funding dried up, and that does show. Watching it, you are left with a large number of questions that this movie never clears up, and there are numerous characters I simply want to see more.But while that is a complaint, I do think that can be seen as a good thing that it does leave me wanting more. I want to see more of the Sara Ellington, Doris Reynolds, and Dr. Blake characters, and see their stories fleshed out more. I am very curious to see more about the aliens and how they ended up on earth.To reiterate, although it has its flaws, I genuinely enjoyed Black Zone and fervently hope to see more of this universe.I also want to add that I think everyone in the cast did an amazing job, and I'm especially inclined to praise the performances of Andrea Fantauzzi, Jennifer Seward, and Matthew Schmidli.

reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.title: Fascinating window into Russian Vors
reviews.content: Those who enjoy mafia movies or atmospheric underground will LOVE this movie! It introduces audiences to the Vors, a Russian variant of tattooed criminals who haunt the characters from the past to modern day New York. It's a great streaming watch, particularly when paired with mafia / yakuza / Irish mob films for a full-on binge. Also, Nikita Bogolyubov is mad eye candy. üòç The entire cast is amazing, and it's rare you get such international flair and atmosphere in a movie that isn't dubbed and is filmed in English. Mad props to the director for pulling that off flawlessly. I love the music and also the tattoos!!!

reviews.title: Dr. Zhivago Meets Goodfellas with a Side of Jean-Claude Van Damme
reviews.content: What's most amazing about Max Weissberg's epic Russian adventure is that it's able to saddle its narrative upon a variety of genres without being beholden to any one: it manages to maintain a distinct old world feel, despite its new world provenance.There are elements of action thrillers mixed in with the mob genre, epic narratives and soap opera. It jumps between time periods in a way that is at times disconcerting, but in the end manages to pull all these divergent strings together into a rather compelling piece that makes you feel a peculiar empathy for the slightly sociopathic protagonist.The fact that Weissberg was able to accomplish this ambitious concept within the framework of such a limited budget is truly laudable.The performances are all on point and believable, the score, moving and powerful, and the storyline draws you into the Machiavellian existence of its characters.Still, there was some drag to the third act, which might have been lessened with more plot twists, more surprises, but all in all, it was a satisfying film.

reviews.title: Showing us a solid low budget indie action
reviews.content: Creating an action film on such a modest budget is always a challenge but fortunately the team on White Crow showed us what is looks like to develop out a good action story as best they could within the limitations they had! You have some very simple locations in some circumstances however given the restrictions they were working with, this was going to be expected and the team managed to create a very interesting story, with a very diverse and capable cast, showcasing a variety of thrilling action sequences, thanks to the stunt team involved and a great original IP to build upon in future sequels (hopefully). It would be great to see how the team would scale up and further improve the finish of the production, I'm excited for the journey White Crow could take.

reviews.title: A Company of Thieves
reviews.content: Company of Thieves delivers a compelling study in character development that elevates the film well beyond a conventional cat-and-mouse thriller.At the heart of the film is the thief, whose journey is not merely about evasion but also about grappling with a conflicted sense of self. His actions-both ruthless and vulnerable-invite the audience to consider the personal sacrifices and moral dilemmas inherent in a life of crime. Rather than presenting him as a flat antagonist, the film paints a picture of a man burdened by his past, striving to outmaneuver both his pursuers and his own internal demons.There is subtle nuanced critique of large corporations, a wonderful musical accompaniment, and solid acting. A very well-made independent film.Worth the watch. - J. Begalke.

reviews.title: A good western twist
reviews.content: I like the movie, it is well directed and all the cast are excellent. The movie had some slow scenes but overall it is exciting. There were few twist and turns and kept me pretty much involved right through the movie. At times it kept me guessing the next scenes to bond and good job by the director. The photography was excellent with some beautiful sceneries. The scripts are very good and I throughly enjoyed it. Tony Nato has acted pretty good and Naomi Helen's role was very good and I think she was outstanding. A lot of good lessons to learn from the movies, and I would recommend this movie. I wish the director all best and good luck with all future endeavors.

reviews.title: A wonderful film - must watch
reviews.content: Just watched "The Company of Thieves"!I loved the film. The story, the music, and the cinematography were all spot on. The film was as suspenseful as it was emotionally engaging, and we were captivated from start to finish. I found the story both compelling and thought-provoking. The film's pacing is impeccable, offering just the right amount of tension before each twist. The film shines not just through its gripping plot, but through its rich, multifaceted characters. I loved the beautiful dialogue and philosophical conversations shared between the 2 main characters (played by Tony Noto and Naomi Helen Weissberg).All in all, I loved the film and would definitely recommend watching it asap!

reviews.title: A must watch with a unique western touch!
reviews.content: It was an absolute delight to watch this movie! While it embraces the classic Western style, it still feels refreshingly different and unique. The soothing background music adds to the immersive experience, perfectly complementing the film's tone. The subtle taste and touch of the Western genre bring a deep sense of satisfaction, making it a truly enjoyable watch. Moreover, the entire cast delivered outstanding performances, each justifying their role exceptionally well. Overall, a beautifully crafted film that is both engaging and memorable! Highly recommended! Wishing the entire crew the best in future productions.

reviews.title: Worth Watching
reviews.content: I have to say my favourtie quote from this movie was " A lazy Buffalo drinks dirty water". In all the westerns I have watched through out my life, I never heard this quote before. I thought the movie was done very well and there was definite chemistry between the two cast members that played the Marshall and the wanted man. You can tell there was definite on screen chemistry. I was trying to narrow down to what specific drcade this was in , and I thought perhaps 1860's and then saw the wanted poster of Jesse James and believe he was a wanted man during 1869. So the portrayal was pretty accurate and it was entertaining. I also liked the card game that was played between father and son, and the father trying to teach the son life is not fair. I think this young director Viduran Roopan shows us how versatile he truely is with this script he wrote and his directoral debut.
